114232.content:
“I was wondering if you could tell me more about what exactly it is that your mom had done to tinies in the past?”
As you asked this you saw a brief look of confusion flash across Quinn’s face.
“Why do you want to know that? I wouldn’t think you’d want to hear about the horrible things she does to people like you,” the look of confusion only lasted a second, going back to her usual neutral expression fairly quickly.
“Well, I guess it just seems like you’re not the kind of person who would talk about this kind of stuff normally. I think it would be good for you to get it out,” what you said to Quinn was true, but since this was Quinn’s mom, you also wanted to get information so you knew what to avoid if she ever came over while you were here. “It’s not good to keep this sort of stuff to yourself, it would maybe be good for you to talk about it.”
Quinn’s cheeks blushed slightly and she showed a faint smile before quietly uttering a soft “thanks”.

She shifted uncomfortably, seeming reluctant to talk about it.
“Quinn, we don’t have to talk about it if you don’t want to. If I overstepped we can talk about something-“ you were cut off again as Quinn’s nervous talking interrupted you again.
“No I’m good, it’s fine... I’m just trying to think of where to start.”
She sat there for a few moments, trying to figure out where to start. Suddenly she seemed to think of something.

“Ok so... as I said I had a lot of tiny friends growing up. My mom was usually very discreet in how she got rid of them, most of the time I suspected she had done something to them but there was never any evidence,” she sighed, obviously thinking about all the friends she had lost. “Until one time that I had two friends over, they were brothers, twins. Their names were Jack and Henry. This was when I was around fourteen. We were in my room, just chatting, when I suddenly needed to use the bathroom. On the way out I noticed my mom standing in the hall, in hindsight she was probably eavesdropping on us. I don’t know why, but I noticed at the time that she was standing barefoot.”
“So I go and use the bathroom, I’m only in there for five minutes at most. When I come out my mom was waiting outside. She said that Jack and Harry’s parents had showed up and they had left. I had thought it was strange but I just shrugged and took her word for it. Just as I walked past I happened to glance down and see that she was wearing a pair of tan socks. I had thought it was strange but didn’t realise what had actually happened till after I walked into my room and sat down.” She paused, clearly collecting herself. You put your hand on her thumb reassuringly once again, which got another small smile from her.
“So I rushed downstairs to confront her about it... but once I got downstairs I saw her pulling on some running shoes over my friends. I actually saw one of their faces on the sole of her foot! I was in so much shock I couldn’t say anything. She turned to look at me and got this huge smile on her face, she said something along the lines of “oh my sweet little angel, you look more beautiful every day” before hugging me,” she almost seemed to gag at the thought of her mother’s shower of affection. “I couldn’t bring myself to confront her, she was being so doting and loving, I couldn’t start a fight with her about it. She was one of the few people I was really close to at that time, I didn’t want to risk that. So I didn’t do anything, and she went off on a run, she must have ditched them somewhere because I never saw her wearing them again, and I didn’t see them ever again. They could still be out somewhere because I was too afraid to ruin my relationship with my mom, as well as all the other tiny guys she’s gotten rid of over the years.”
A single tear rolled its way down Quinn’s pale cheek, and there was a faint wetness in her eyes. She obviously felt incredibly guilty about it. Still holding your hands on her thumb, you looked up to your giantess roommate.
“Quinn, none of that was your fault. Your mom made those choices, it’s perfectly understandable to not want to jeopardise your relationship with her since it’s obvious you two were really close. Please don’t blame yourself,” she hung her head low even as you said this. “Just give me a warning whenever she comes over so I can find a good hiding place.”
You thought ending with a lighthearted joke would be best to cheer her up, and you did get a faint chuckle out of her.
“Thanks Hunter.”

She looked down at you with a slightly more serious face.
“I’ll give you warning before she comes over if she ever does, I haven’t told her where I live yet but I imagine she’ll find out eventually. So I’ll give you a few tips on her behaviour around tiny guys. She will act innocent and sweet when me or any other people her size are around. She usually crushes tinies on purpose but will pass it off as an accident. I’d also guess that she’d try to hide you on herself somewhere the instant she’s alone, because whenever a friend disappeared it was usually after I’d left them alone. I also don’t have any evidence for this but I’m sure she probably used Shipping Hero to get rid of some of them, but I can’t say for sure. So if she ever comes here I’ll make sure either me, Morgan or Avery will be with you at all times,” she didn’t smile down at you, but you could tell from her eyes that she was trying to reassure you. “Normally I’d be inclined to let you fend for yourself, but I’ve lost too many friends to her to let that happen.”
“Thanks Quinn, and for my part I’ll try to keep a low profile when she’s around,” you smile up to her.
“Yeah that’s probably best.”

What happens next?
1) You and Quinn continue to talk.
2) Morgan and Avery want to do something as a group.
3) There’s a knock at the door, Becky has tracked Quinn down and come to visit.
114232.title: Learning about Becky

choices: Alone with Becky
Dinner supplied by Becky
Can Quinn save you
1142323.content:
Quinn wiped her eyes with the sleeve of her sweater, before sniffing and attempting to keep her neutral expression.
You smiled, amused by Quinn’s determination too keep up her apathetic appearance despite having just had a very deep conversation with you and having already shed tears in front of you. The more time that you spent with Quinn, the more interesting she became to you.
You felt that, despite having had an incredibly deep and revealing conversation with her, there was still much more to learn about her.

Just as you were about to open your mouth to continue conversing with her, Quinn stood up.
“Want to go and see what Morgan and Avery are up to?” She looked down at you, her face once again completely neutral.

You were slightly disappointed that you wouldn’t be able to continue your one on one conversation with Quinn, but you shrugged, you would be able to continue it another time.
“Sure, sounds good to me,” you gave her a thumbs up and Quinn lowered her palm, gesturing for you to hop on.

You both made your way downstairs to the living room, where Morgan and Avery were sitting watching tv. Morgan was sat on a reclining chair whereas Avery was sprawled out across the couch.
As you both entered the twins heads turned to look at you. Avery sat up straight, making space for both you and Quinn on the couch.

“Aw, looks like the two lovebirds have decided to join us Morgan. Did you two enjoy your alone time?” Avery teased. “I bet Hunter’s a totes amazing kisser. Am
I right Quinn?”
As Avery finished speaking she jokingly started to make kissing noises while giggling at Quinn. Quinn’s face blushed faintly and you could see her normally neutral expression begin to turn to embarrassment.

“W-what? No... I- We didn’t do... we just- ugh!” Quinn huffed in frustration at her stammering, before Avery burst into laughter at the normally calm and collected woman’s obvious embarrassment at her teasing. Even Morgan was suppressing a giggle. You glanced back towards Quinn with a smile, her adorable reaction to a fairly lighthearted joke by Avery was something you found incredibly endearing.

Without another word, and still blushing heavily, Quinn walked over to the couch. She sat on the far side from Avery, depositing you on the middle cushion between them. Normally this couch would be large enough for three normal sized people to sit on, but with Quinn’s massive hips taking up more than just her cushion, you doubted three people would fit on it currently.

The four of you spent the next hour watching TV and chatting. Quinn was slow to join in on the conversation, still recovering from her embarrassment, but Avery’s exuberant personality more than filled that void.
You all talked about plans that you each had for the next few days, got to know each other better, and discussed dinner plans. You weren’t squished at all since you had plenty of space between Avery and Quinn’s thighs, having almost a full couch cushion to yourself.

The conversation was interrupted by the sound of the doorbell. Everyone looked around confused, before Morgan shrugged and got up to go and answer the door. A few moments passed during which you and Avery talked about her job. Your conversation was interrupted by a woman’s voice, shouting in excitement.
“Quinnie!”

The three of you turned towards the door and saw Morgan, who looked shocked at both the appearance and sudden outburst of the woman who had just walked into the room with her. Dressed in a simple blue top, a short black skirt and a pair of tan tights was Quinn’s mother, Becky.
The picture that Quinn had shown you did not do her appearance justice, she was a vision of beauty. Her enormous curves were almost comical in comparison to Morgan, who was already curvy in her own right, making Becky’s curves all the more impressive. You could see Avery’s jaw drop as she took in Becky’s impressive form, the pink haired girl’s shock and amazement written all over her face.
The voluptuous woman was almost bouncing in excitement at seeing her daughter, who’s eyes were widened in surprise at her mom’s unexpected visit.

“Mom... What are you doing here? I hadn’t told you where I lived yet, how’d you find out?” Quinn seemed more puzzled than anything else.

“Oh don’t worry about that sweetie, all that matters is that I’m here and we can celebrate your first day in your new apartment!” Becky squealed in excitement before rushing towards Quinn and embracing her in a big hug, kissing her on the cheek repeatedly despite her daughters struggles. After a few moments of showering affection on her daughter, Becky slid off of the top of her daughter onto the couch next to her.

You witnessed Becky’s display of affection before you were cast in the shadow of her meteoric backside descending towards you rapidly. Her skirt, which barely covered any of her mammoth, tights covered backside, fluttered upwards, revealing the whole of her titanic rear. You could barely process what was happening before your entire world was taken up by the crushing sensation of Becky’s ass grinding you into the couch.
Avery was pushed over towards the arm rest as all available space was taken up by Becky’s wide hips shimmying to get comfortable.
“Oh sorry dear, I was so excited to see my little angel that I forgot how much space I can take up,” Becky turned to Avery apologetically.

“No probs Mrs Wallace! I’m Avery,” as Avery introduced herself, Quinn quickly realised where you were and her eyes went wide in panic.

“Uh... mom, could you... stand up please,” normally Quinn wouldn’t be struggling to find the right words when speaking to Becky, but this was a delicate situation and you were potentially in a lot of danger if she couldn’t get you away from her mom. “You’re sitting on my other roommate.”

“What? Sorry Quinnie, but I think I’d have noticed if I had sat on a whole other person,” Becky giggled at what she assumed was a joke.

“No uh... my other roommate isn’t a normal sized person... He’s a tiny guy,” Quinn winced as she said the words, knowing that her mom wouldn’t be pleased that she was roommates with what she viewed to be vermin.

“Ah I see. Sorry Quinnie,” without a break in her cheery expression, Becky stood up, revealing your poor crumpled form stuck to the couch cushion. Your tiny body had been utterly obliterated by the meteoric impact Becky’s ass.

Quinn rapidly peeled you off of the cushion, giving you a concerned look as she did so. You both knew the danger that Becky presented to you, Quinn was actually surprised her mom had stood up to let you go. Worse still, Avery and Morgan were completely unaware of Becky’s opinion of tiny guys.

“Sorry about that Quinnie, you know how hard it can be for me to see what’s underneath my tush,” she looked at Quinn with care as she said this, but as her eyes glanced down at you they conveyed a threat that you seemed to be the only one to pick up on.

Quinn set your slowly reforming body down on the coffee table, since there wasn’t anymore space for you left on the couch. Conversation picked back up again, mostly Becky getting to know Morgan and Avery while also bragging about how amazing she thought Quinn was, much to Quinn’s embarrassment.

After a short while you reformed and attempted to join back in the conversation. However, every time you spoke up, Becky seemed to just talk louder and more energetically, drowning out your tiny voice with ease. Whenever she would do this, she would wait till the conversation was no longer focused on her, after which she would glance down at you with disdain. Her expression never shifted from her warm, motherly smile, but you could see the malice in her eyes.
You also noticed that your roommates, especially Avery and Morgan, seemed to be looking at you less and less as the conversation was going on. You could tell that Becky was trying to divert everyone’s attention away from you, and apart from Quinn’s occasional glance towards you, she seemed to be succeeding.

Does Becky’s plan proceed how she wants?

1) Yes, and Becky manages to isolate you from your roommates.
2) No, and as the conversation progresses, Becky offers to buy everyone dinner.
3) She manages to crush you when she thinks no one is looking, but Quinn spots her doing it.
1142323.title: Surprise Visit From Becky.

choices: Becky gets one of your roommates to unknowingly torment you.
Becky stealthily adds you as an ingredient to dinner.
Becky hides you somewhere on herself, then heads into the kitchen.
11423231.content:
“Whoa!” Morgan suddenly shouted, jumping to her feet. “I almost totally forgot that I was about to start getting dinner ready.”
Avery grinned playfully. “Geez sis, NOW who’s the forgetful one!” She giggled, and then paused. “Though, I guess I totes forgot too…”

Morgan rolled her eyes and grabbed her sister’s hand, yanking her to her feet. As she did so, she bumped into the coffee table, jostling it and knocking you flat onto your face. Without even a glance backward, Morgan led Avery around the couch and towards the kitchen, pausing by the door. If there was any clear evidence that you’d slipped their minds since Becky’s arrival, that was it.

“It won’t be much more than some lasagna and garlic bread, but you are more than welcome to stay with us for dinner, Miss Wallace.” Morgan offered, and Becky smiled warmly.

“Oh, that’s so kind of you dear!” She put a hand to her abundant chest. “I’d be delighted.”

Morgan nodded, then glanced at Quinn. “We might actually need your help too, Quinn. We’re a bit behind schedule as is.”

Quinn paused for a second, and glanced uneasily at you down on the table. “Uh…s-sure. Give me a sec.”

“No problemo, Quinno!” Avery lilted with a smile, before disappearing into the kitchen with her twin.

Not wanting to leave you alone with her mother for even a second, Quinn started to stand up, while also reaching for you. However, before she could secure you in her grasp, Becky’s hand shot out and lightly gripped her daughter’s wrist, stopping her.

“Quinn, darling. Go help your friends.” Becky smiled pleasantly. “I feel like I’ve hardly let this poor little guy get a single word in during our conversation. Please allow me to get to…know him a little better.” Becky’s expression was nothing but happy and sincere, but even from your perspective down on the table, you could see the glint of ill-intent in Becky’s eyes.

You could only assume that Quinn saw it too, but unfortunately, Quinn clearly hadn’t fully conquered her past trauma with her tiny-hating mother. You could practically see the indecision all over Quinn’s face, as she mentally wrestled with the prospects of standing up to her mother. Finally, the fear of damaging one of the few precious relationships she held close to her heart won out, and Quinn relented, withdrawing her hand.

With just another quick glance at you, Quinn shuffled out of the room, and vanished into the kitchen with the Sinclair sisters. All alone in the living room with Becky, you dragged your gaze from the room where your three roommates had gone off to, and over to the absurdly curvaceous and gorgeous form of Becky, who towered far above you even while seated. Her smile remained, but it had taken on a decidedly less friendly appearance.

Gulping, you frantically tried to establish some friendly groundwork. Perhaps prove you weren’t just some lay about, perverted tiny. You stammered out a greeting. “Um…hello! My name is Hunter Woods. Don’t know if anyone said it yet! Heh. Uh…nice to meet you, Miss–”

“Don’t address me by name, bug.” Becky sneered, the blunt coldness of her voice physically shocking you. It was so jarringly different from her clingy and sweet persona from just a minute ago. How could this woman possess two starkly different personalities and portray them both with sincerity? Why did the simple fact of being tiny generate this aura of malice from her?

You paled, blood running cold. “Uh…should I call you something else?”

Becky rolled her eyes with annoyance. “Ugh, I hate hearing you little bugs talk. Your tinny voices are so grating. Can’t you all just be like other bugs and stay silent?”

Her overbearing nastiness was beginning to egg you own, and you couldn’t stop yourself from showing some backbone. “Hey, tinies are people too. Can you please be a bit nicer? I’m just being friendly.”

“Hah! Is that right?” Becky scoffed a harsh laugh, then leaned over you. The shadow her body cast over you enshrouded you in darkness, and your bravado started to shrivel up. “Let me make your pathetic little position clear, bug, by getting two things straight.”

She ticked off one of her fingers. “One: tinies are not people. They are annoying little nuisances that make real people’s lives inconvenient. Don’t you know what else in the world is an inch tall and squishes pathetically? Bugs! And what are bugs fit for? Being trampled underfoot without a second thought!”

Becky grinned smugly, then ticked another finger off. “Two: there is no such thing as a tiny being friendly. All tinies are two-faced liars and degenerates. They are perverted little monsters that flaunt their vulnerability and freakish genetics to get sympathy from the bleeding hearts of politicians. All these tiny-rights laws were made by people who don’t know the truth. Not like I do.”

Her impassioned speech, delivered at a quiet but powerful whisper, had completely taken you off guard. Even Quinn’s warning about her mother’s hatred of tinies hadn’t prepared you for as angry a viewpoint as this. Becky’s face was filled with malice and contempt, and just the way she looked at you made it clear that she saw you as sub-human. Beneath her, and hardly worth her attention.

At the same time, as she was talking about ‘knowing the truth about tinies’, there was a small sign of grief in her eyes. Though you could only make an inference, you began to wonder if it was possible that all of Becky’s rage against tinies had been born so long time ago in the past, involving a traumatic incident with a tiny (or a group of tinies). Did she have some sort of past memory that was twisting her current actions in such a way as this?

Too afraid to ask, you could only stutter out a helpless decree. “I-I don’t know…what to say, ma’am. I don’t a-agree with you. I think I’m a pretty normal guy just trying to live my life. Finding a home with my new roommates is my perfect chance to get a new start on life and really come into my own. Also, meeting Quinn has–”

Becky had looked supremely disinterested in your rebuttal, up until you mentioned Quinn’s name. Snapping to attention, Becky grinned like a shark securing its prey. “Ah! There it is! My precious daughter, my sweet little angel, my Quinnie! You perverted little freaks just want to take advantage of her, abuse her, satisfy yourselves with her!”

You gaped. “What? No! Of course not! I consider Quinn to be a great friend!”

Becky waved a hand dismissively. “Don’t lie, because it won’t work on me. I already told you that I know the truth about tinies.” She groaned, and ran a hand through her hair. “Damn. I’ve gotten softer on the bugs. I would’ve never had a conversation with someone like you back in the day. My Quinnie hanging out near a tiny? Bam. Molded into a thong and donated to the local thrift shop. My sweet angel brings a tiny friend home for a playdate? That tiny finds a new permanent home in my underwear drawer.”

You began to shake with panic, and glanced nervously between Becky and the kitchen door. All you could hear from the kitchen were laughs and the sound of the oven. Your three roommates were probably having a blast bustling around to whip up dinner, all while you were being berated and insulted by this clearly devout tiny-hater. You seriously doubted a single thing you could say at this point would soothe her.

Instead, you took the only option left. You opened your mouth and shouted. “QUINN! PLEASE–”

As soon as the first syllable left your mouth, Becky rammed her fist down onto the coffee table, splattering your body effortlessly into a mashed blob. Your cry for help died in your throat, and you could just barely hear the sound of boisterous giggling from the kitchen, courtesy of Avery. Her laughter easily drowned out what little cry you had been able to shout before Becky’s intervention, and your roommates remained blissfully unaware of the vengeful mother taking action in the living room.

Becky stood up from the couch as she peeled you from the table, and deposited your crumpled body in her palm. Grimacing down at you with sheer disdain, she sighed. “And now, I have the annoying task of finding a suitable way to dispose of you. A fittingly humiliating end to a bug like yourself. Serious enough that maybe, just maybe, you learn your place.” She sighed wistfully. “At the very least, you won’t ever be able to manipulate my Quinnie ever again.”

She began to absentmindedly squeeze and squish your body between her fingers, using you like a makeshift stress toy, as she ran ideas through her head. Try as you might to wiggle or squirm, it was absolutely impossible to escape her grasp now. She had you all to herself, and if some stray miracle didn’t occur now, you genuinely began to fear for your fate. Whatever plan she settled on would not be pleasant.

Though her exact reasonings for despising tinies were still a mystery to you, it was one-hundred percent clear that you would never, ever receive mercy from Becky Wallace.
11423231.title: Becky's Disdain

choices: You want to go with Morgan and find a job at "Workout World".
You want to go with Avery and find a job at "Starlight Studios".
You want to go with Quinn and find a job at "Sanderson Beach".
115.content:
“Hey, I actually have a question for each of you.” You said after a moment. Seeing each of your new roommates look a bit more intently at you after saying that froze you up for a second, and you coughed awkwardly. “I-it’s a little…strange, I guess.”

Morgan smiled calmingly. “Go on. You don’t think we’re going to judge you, or anything, right?”

Avery cheerfully grinned. “Ask away, little buddy! We’d do anything for our tiny new roommate!”

Quinn motioned with her head for you to continue. “What’s up?”

You cleared your throat. “Well, just like you three, I’ve now graduated college. I have a degree in Communications, but honestly, it’s not my passion. I guess I don’t really have a direction in life. I consider myself pretty competent, especially for a tiny, but I don’t have a clue what my future has in store for me.” You paused to shuffle your feet awkwardly. “Basically, I wanted to hear about the jobs that you three have. Maybe that would give me some ideas.”

Morgan’s eyes widened. “Oh. Is that all? Were you thinking of maybe tagging along with us to our jobs and applying?”

Avery practically squealed with delight at the very thought. “Eee! That’s so cute!”

Quinn nodded approvingly. “Makes sense. Good idea, Hunter.”

“Thanks.” You replied to Quinn, before looking at Morgan. “Morgan, could you start?”

“Oh, totally.” The dark brown-haired girl said. “So, I’ve been working as an assistant employee at this local gym for a little while now. It’s called ‘Workout World’. It’s your standard gym, with a whole bunch of exercise machines and weights and what-not. We also have a few rooms in the back for special daily and weekly classes.

“After working at the gym for a while, I was just recently promoted. I now teach a weekly yoga class starting…tomorrow, I guess…and I’m really pumped about that. Might have trouble reigning myself in.” Morgan sheepishly smiled, admitting to her intensive workout routine. “But yeah, other than that I just do odds and ends jobs at the gym. Cleaning, registering new members, helping people with troublesome machines. That sort of thing.”

“Gotcha!” You said, giving her a thumbs up. “Thank you for being so thorough. How about you, Avery?” You asked, turning to the pink-haired giantess.

Avery grinned wildly. “Okay, so like, I have the best job in the world. I’m totally pretty, right?” Avery struck a pose and giggled, earning a nod from you and Quinn, and an eye roll from Morgan. “Apparently, other people totes think so too, because I got recruited right out of high school to be a model! And, and, and…” Avery nearly hyperventilated. “…I just landed the biggest gig of my life. I’m going to be a featured model for Starlight Studios!

“If you’re a nerd and don’t know…” Avery stuck out her tongue at Morgan playfully. “…Starlight Studios is a really huge photo agency near here. I’ve been there a few weeks, and it’s uber heaven! I can just wear cute outfits all day, pose for the camera, and come home with so much dough! Best of all, there totes aren’t any tiny models working at the studios, so you’d have a hella easy time getting hired!”

You took a moment to take all that in, then nodded. “Uh…thanks Avery. That sounds like a lot of fun. What about you, Quinn?” You inquired, looking at last to your final roommate.

The black-haired girl shrugged. “It’s not much, really. Nothing special. I wanted to get outside and around people a bit more, so I applied as a lifeguard at the beach near here. ‘Sanderson Beach’, heard of it? Anyway, they picked me. I’ve been working there for a month now. It’s not too bad, I guess, though the sun is hell on my skin. I have to put sunscreen on twice a day, at least.

“But…yeah, it’s as simple as it sounds. I’m either assigned to sit in one of the lifeguard towers and look out over the beach for any signs of trouble, or I patrol the sands, up and down the beach, and help people that way. Boring, but the right kind of boring.” She paused. “And it feels good to help people out…sometimes.”

You nodded appreciatively. “Okay, thank you, Quinn.”

Morgan leaned forward in her seat, a glimmer of hopefulness shining in her eyes. “Realistically, Hunter, you could only take one job. So, who do you want to go into work with tomorrow?”

Avery also leaned forward in her seat, though much more dramatically than her twin, and her breasts threatened to spill from her top. It was hard not to look. “Yeah, yeah! Who do you wanna tag along with, cutie?”

Quinn made no attempt to lean in, but she did raise her eyebrow questioningly. “Doesn’t matter to me who you go with.” She said nonchalantly.

For some reason, you could feel that this was a tremendously important moment, and so you really stopped to think about it. Who did you want to go with, and what job were you looking to pursue?
115.title: Entering the Job Market

choices: Heather wants you to teach the yoga class right alongside Morgan.
Heather needs you to fix some broken exercise machines giving her trouble.
Heather asks you to do some one-on-one fitness coaching with gym members.
1151.content:
“Actually, I think that working at the gym would be a pretty easy job for me to handle.” You reasoned. “I feel like there’s probably a lot I could do there that might help out. And I mean, I’m pretty fit for a tiny. I could help show people how to do stretches and stuff.”

Morgan smiled warmly. “I agree! ‘Workout World’ having a tiny fitness instructor helping out would be amazing.”

You could tell that Avery was pretty upset that you hadn’t picked her, and Quinn seemed mostly indifferent like normal, but with a twinge of disappointment on her face. However, there really was no way around it. It’d be impossible for you to balance three jobs at once. You just decided that you would need to hang out with them later to make it up to them.

The rest of the day passed by fairly uneventfully. The four of you spend time hanging around and chatting in the living room, eventually transitioning into watching a movie. The movie came after dinner, which was efficiently prepared by Morgan and served by Quinn. It was really just a few frozen meals heated up, but it was still a meaningful gesture and a tasty experience.

After the movie finished, it was nearing ten o’clock at night, and each of the girls meandered upstairs to their rooms. Surprisingly, they each seemed to have forgotten about you, and left you all by yourself on the couch in the living room. You couldn’t really blame them, as this was only the first night for the three girls living under the same roof as a tiny like yourself. Your existence hadn’t become fully routine for them yet. Thankfully, it wasn’t too cold in the living room, and the couch cushion was nice and comfy, so you easily fell asleep.

*****

You awoke to Morgan standing above you, gently saying your name to ease you out of slumber land. Giggling at your messy hair and bleary expression, Morgan carried you into the bathroom where you freshened up, and then into the kitchen. She fixed herself some cereal, making sure to give you a few crunchy pieces and a bottle cap filled with milk to serve as your own breakfast. It was incredible how good of a caretaker she was.

After breakfast, you both got changed into fresh sets of clothes, and you had to fight not to stare too much as Morgan returned from her bedroom wearing only a dark blue sports bra and matching compression shorts. Her clothing left most of her smooth, toned body on full display, while also highlighting and accentuating her sculpted curves. She was like a goddess of fitness, the ideal vision of physical perfection.

Your staring did not go unnoticed, and Morgan playfully flicked you for ogling her, before picking you up again. Saying goodbye to Quinn, who was eating her own breakfast (Avery was apparently still asleep upstairs), you and Morgan left the apartment. Morgan only took a small bag of spare clothes and a water bottle with her. She walked straight out to her car, and slid inside.

Depositing you gently in the passenger’s seat, you held onto the tethered seat belt to anchor yourself, and then the two of you were off. It was only a twenty-minute drive to “Workout World”, and you passed the time chatting with Morgan. She was the only girl you’d ever met outside of your family who treated you respectfully and sincerely, and earnestly treated you like a normal human being. It was an amazing feeling, and a flutter went off in your chest each time she smiled at you.

Pulling up to “Workout World”, Morgan parked her car, scooped you into her palm, grabbed her bag, and then headed inside. As she approached the gym, you noted that it didn’t look particularly too crazy from the outside. Just a run-of-the-mill gym, but perhaps a bit bigger than normal. It looked like it stretched back for a while, taking up a decent amount of space.

This observation was explained when Morgan walked through the door. Exercise machines as far as the eye could see stretched in all directions. Bikes, treadmills, rowing machines, elliptical machines, stair walkers, and more. One whole wall was taken up by a wide array of exercise mats, jump ropes, yoga balls, weights, and other assorted workout props. In the far back, you could see the doors leading to those exercise class rooms Morgan had mentioned.

Your giantess carrier approached the front desk, where a brilliantly smiling receptionist was waiting. The receptionist stood as Morgan approached, and you verbally choked.

The receptionist (who appeared to be in her thirties), was dressed in the same attire as Morgan, a sports bra and compression shorts. This indicated she was also a fitness instructor. However, due to being older and more mature, her more developed body strained at the seams of the sports bra and shorts, threatening to snap the fabric at any second. It was an incredibly risqué outfit choice.

Or, it would’ve been under normal circumstances. Glancing around the gym, which already had quite a few people in it, you didn’t see a single guy. There were giantesses of all ages, but no men to be seen. Was this a female only gym, or just a random coincidence?

“Good morning, Miss Mayfield.” Morgan waved to the receptionist. It was then that you noted the receptionist’s nametag, pinned proudly to her right breast. It read: ‘Heather Mayfield, Workout World Director’. Apparently, she was the big boss around here, but it was hard to fully believe that. Something about her aforementioned revealing clothing, and her mane of wavy blonde hair and young-looking face felt out of place.

“Mah stars, Morgan!” Heather clapped her hands together and grinned. “Is that a darlin’ lil’ tiny in yer hand?” She asked, pointing to you. Her southern drawl was unexpected, but her tone was light and airy.

“Yes, ma’am.” Morgan nodded. “He’s my new roommate, Hunter. He was wondering if he could apply for a job here.”

Heather beamed at you and Morgan. “Why, I reckon’ he can, honey! Shoot, ah’ll draw up the contract fer ya’ll right now!” The buxom woman bent over to dig around in her desk for a paper and pen, and you couldn’t help but notice the pendulum swaying motion of her tits as she did so. It was difficult to imagine this curvy woman leading any fitness classes. She reminded you of your own mother, actually.

Finally, she stood back up, contract in hand. Placing it proudly on the desk in front of you, you hopped down from Morgan’s hand and read it carefully. Everything seemed to be in order, so with some help from Morgan, it only took you a minute to sign your name. You were now an official member of the ‘Workout World’ team. That was easy!

Smiling down at you in a friendly manner, Morgan gave you a thumbs up, then returned her attention to her boss. “So, Miss Mayfield, what’s on my agenda today?”

Heather waved dismissively at Morgan. “Morgan, honey, ah told ya to call me Heather. But, anywho, yer main job today is to teach that yoga class. ‘Sides that, just help out ‘til yer shift ends.”

“And what should I do Miss…er…Heather?” You spoke up, striking a confident pose.

Heather laughed uproariously at your show of bravado, infectiously guffawing for a solid thirty seconds before calming down. “You, lil’ mister, have a special task fer yer first day. Ready fer it?”

You nodded enthusiastically, and Heather cleared her throat before continuing.
1151.title: First Day at the Gym

choices: Aoi continually messes with you during the class, as much as possible.
You stay safe from Aoi...but keep ending up under hyper-focused Morgan instead!
*Writer's Choice*
11511.content:
“There are two big thangs every gym employee needs ta know!” Heather smiled warmly at you, but with an earnest and serious look in her eye. “One: Ya gotta know yer stuff. How else can ya help out? Two: Ya gotta be all comfy-like around strangers. I’m expectin’ ya’ll to help anyone in need, and ya have ta be ready fer that.”

You nodded vigorously. “Oh, I’m sure I can handle that, Heather!”

Heather’s intensity eased up a little. “I know ya can, little guy. I believe in ya, Hunter. Tha’s why yer first task is ta co-teach with my darlin’ Morgan. Both of ya can work together.”

This surprised you slightly, but also made a reasonable amount of sense. You just hoped Morgan wouldn’t feel like you were intruding on her personal class. “O-of course, Heather. I’d be glad to help Morgan out.”

Heather grinned. “Glad to hear it, honey. Off ya go, now! Reckon’ yer class is startin’ any minute now.”

Without another word, you and Morgan were off. Morgan placed you back in her hand, and you held on nice and tight as she walked quickly towards the back of the Workout World gym, towards one of the side rooms. Slipping inside, you found the room empty of people, but filled with a surplus of exercise gear and supplies. About twenty, tan-colored yoga mats were spread out in rows facing a singular red yoga mat (presumably Morgan’s).

“Alright, Hunter, first day on the job! It’s pretty awesome that we’ll be co-teaching.” She said, beaming at you. This alleviated your earlier worry. “Though, you might want to let me field day one, and just copy my movements. Honestly, can’t imagine that you’ll be too much help for people behind the first row.” The dark brown-haired giantess smiled sheepishly at you. “Maybe later on we can have you walk around with the girls for more focused help.”

11521.title: Modeling for Micro-Flex

choices: Konomi wants to move onto more shots focused on Avery's ass.
Konomi wants to move onto more shots focused on Avery's boobs.

115212.content:
“Avery, please put on some of the women’s line and demonstrate the sticky qualities.” Konomi explained, pointing to a box resting on a table behind your beautiful roommate.

Avery’s expression burst into blissful exuberance. “What? There’s a line for girls too! That’s totes super amazing!” Literally jumping up and down with excitement, you paled at the sight of her hefty chest bouncing in time with her joy. Shaking yourself out of staring, you watched Avery scamper away to the box to get changed. Turning your back on her, you decided that you could at least be a gentleman in some ways.

Konomi tapped her clipboard to get your attention. “Now, Hunter, you might’ve picked up that I mentioned certain ‘sticky qualities’. As this implies, these next set of photos are going to require you being squished or stretched.” She smiled at you, but it didn’t take a genius to see the money-making glint in her eyes. “Will that be a problem?”

You emphatically shook your head. “No ma’am! No problem here!” You put on a show of confidence, even though you weren’t entirely looking forward to what was coming. Still, if this was all a test by Konomi, you weren’t going to back down and fail. And, even if it wasn’t a test, the more money that Konomi made, the more you and Avery would rake in. Win-win situation all around, you figured.

Avery returned after a minute, and her new outfit was a far cry from the casual ensemble she’d worn to the studio. She was clad from her neck to her toes in a sleek, sporty bodysuit that clung so tightly to her curvy supermodel body it might as well have been her second skin. The bodysuit was black with hot pink stripes racing across it, and looked exceptionally comfortable and maneuverable. The rational part of your brain admired the design of the fabric…while the hormonal part of your brain couldn’t stop ogling every inch of Avery. Ironically, despite literally covering most of her skin, the bodysuit left little to the imagination in practice.

Your staring didn’t go unnoticed by Avery, who struck a dynamic pose and winked at you. “You like what ya see, don’tcha, Hunter? Hee hee! It is pretty sick, huh?”

You blushed and averted your eyes, too embarrassed to mumble an apology or excuse, which only further enriched Avery’s infectious giggles. Konomi was smiling too, but another look into her eyes told you that the gears in her head were spinning. What they were spinning about, only time would tell.

“Okay, you two.” Konomi clapped her hands. “Time to jump into it. These next few photos will involve most of our varying sets, but only for context and lighting purposes. The main point is to highlight how Micro-flex outfits stick and adhere to one another.” She eyed Avery carefully. “You’ll need to squish Hunter a bit, alright?”

Avery frowned just a little. “Oh. I will? On purpose?”

“Yes, but he’s okay with that. He already told me that it doesn’t bother him at all.” Konomi said, the lie sliding easily out of her lips.

You jerked your head over to her. “W-wait, I didn’t exactly say–”

“Oh, awesome! Okay then!” Avery exclaimed, her bright and cheery voice cutting off your attempt at clarification. Before you could try again, Konomi picked you up and carried you over to the fake gym set in the studio. A bit callously, she dropped you down onto the floor beside a treadmill, then sauntered over to adjust the camera. You picked yourself up off of the floor, once more amazed at how immaculate and clean your clothes were. Micro-flex was genuinely revolutionary.

Konomi steadied the camera, then motioned to Avery. “Alright, Avery. Simple shot first. Step on up and then…well…STEP onto Hunter.”

Apparently still a little apprehensive, Avery responded with a weak nod, biting her lip in an adorable fashion. Walking over to you, you were momentarily taken aback by just how humongous she was side-by-side with your bug-sized body. She was a gorgeous, heavenly goddess of a giantess, and standing down at her feet made you feel a mix of both awe and fear. You didn’t quite know why.

Well, maybe it was fear of the obvious, as, after sparing you a quick smile, Avery stepped down onto you, burying you under her left foot. Your body offered no resistance, flattening out into a paper-thin shape immediately. You were crushed out into a disc against Avery’s heel, and, sure enough, you felt your clothes stick to Avery’s bodysuit instantly. It was a strong adhesion too, not unlike glue, and when Avery lifted her foot a second later, you went with it.

Demonstrating her flexibility, Avery twisted her leg up and held her foot in front of her face, spotting the red-colored flat circle that was your body on her heel. Giggling, she lightly poked your body, squishing your face a bit more into her heel.

“Hee hee! One second of squishing, and you’re flat as can be, Hunter. Soooo cute!” Avery gushed.

From a business point of view, Konomi was pleased too, but hardly satisfied. “Excellent, Avery. Now, step on him again, but this time grind your heel along the ground. Really work him into your foot.”

Though an airheaded ditz most of the time, Avery wasn’t dumb, and she looked at Konomi with shock. “Wha? Wouldn’t that hurt the poor cutie?”

Konomi shook her head succinctly. “Not at all. I mentioned that Micro-flex reduces sensations of pain for tinies, remember? Hunter will be just fine.”

This was yet another lie, and you picked up on it right away. However, crushed flat, you had no way of shouting to Avery that Konomi was making things up, so your pink-haired partner simply blinked once to process what Konomi said, then grinned happily. “Oh, okay! That’s totes cool. He’s, like, invincible, huh? Wow!”

Airheaded Avery was back and in full force, and your current position left you powerless to defend yourself. You could just barely manage a wince in preparation for your next few seconds, as Avery just about slammed her foot back onto the ground. Convinced by Konomi’s words that you couldn’t feel a thing right now, Avery ground her heel against the floor with violent, reckless abandon, genuinely laughing at how loose she was letting herself be. Konomi watched with reserved fascination.

When Avery hoisted her foot back up thirty seconds later, you were more of a red stain spread across her entire heel than a simple circle, and were even more adhered to the fabric of her Micro-flex bodysuit than before. This pleased Konomi greatly, and the astute businesswoman eagerly snapped some shots.

“Okay, Avery...and Hunter. Excellent jobs so far.” Konomi glanced at her clipboard. “Micro-flex, along with testing their durability and sticky qualities, would really like us to take some publicity photos for their website that focus on tinies being squished and crushed in day-to-day settings.”

Avery frowned adorably at this direction, and let her foot fall back down, squishing you into the floor once more. “Really? That’s uber weird. Like, how does that make sense for a company that totes supports tinies.”

“It’s simple, Avery.” Konomi said gently, almost soothingly. “By taking fake candid photos, we can supply Micro-flex with data about how their product functions in real-life situations. On top of that, we can provide promotional materials that demonstrate how trapped or squashed tinies can be spotted and rescued, based on how they stick to other Micro-flex materials. Training tools, if you will.”

Avery had been bouncing on her feet during this entire explanation, repeatedly lifting her heels then digging them back down into the floor. Apparently, your current location had fled her vacant mind already. She finally stopped though, and clapped her hands together. “Ah, I gotcha! That’s so crazy awesome! I love helping out like this, and I’m sure Hunter does too!”

Konomi nodded. “Oh, he does. He told me while you were changing that he is good to go with these photo shoots for as many hours as we might need them. He said he’ll do anything for Starlight Studios!” A third lie was just as easy as the others. You didn’t hear a word, buried into the floor because of Avery’s heel, but if you had, you would’ve just been even more upset.

Blushing, Avery bit her lip again, and looked down at her foot, finally remembering where you were. “Sounds like something that little stud would say. OMG, he’s too much!”

“Now, can we continue?” Konomi walked back to the camera, and gestured towards the treadmill. Avery was more than happy to oblige her boss. In her mind, not only was this more fun than she’d had in weeks, but she was determined to not drag down the experience for Konomi and you. As far as she was concerned, you were taking to modeling like it was your calling in life, and Avery would do everything to be the best damn partner for you.

For the next twenty minutes, Avery and Konomi took photos around the gym, with you still stuck to Avery’s foot like you belonged there. Each new step further cemented you in place, the fabric of your clothes and your titanic roommates bodysuit meshing tightly, intertwining. It never stop hurting, and you silently begged for anything else but foot shots. Konomi had Avery posing on the treadmill, the bike, and the Stairmaster, each snapshot focusing on your crushed body and Avery’s impressively nonchalant and unaware attitude. These were all meant to be candid, after all.

When the shooting calmed down, it took Avery and Konomi together to peel you free from Avery’s foot, leaving you as an exhausted flat strip. Konomi scooped you up and held you tightly in her fist as she walked on to the next set, not enough to hurt but enough to keep you flat and unable to yell at her for the way she was tricking Avery into treating you. Powerless, your first day of hellish modeling continued…

1153.content:
“Actually, I think that working at the beach would be a pretty easy job for me to handle.” You reasoned. “I love to help people out, and I think that I’m pretty athletic. I don’t know how good I’d be at saving people, but I can help with any other issues, or be on the lookout for people in need.”

Quinn smiled approvingly. “That’s a good attitude to have. You’ll fit in, I guess.”

You could tell that Morgan was a bit letdown that you hadn’t picked her, and Avery was pretty upset that you hadn’t chosen her either. However, there really was no way around it. It’d be impossible for you to balance three jobs at once. You just decided that you would need to hang out with them later to make it up to them.

The rest of the day passed by fairly uneventfully. The four of you spend time hanging around and chatting in the living room, eventually transitioning into watching a movie. The movie came after dinner, which was efficiently prepared by Morgan and served by Quinn. It was really just a few frozen meals heated up, but it was still a meaningful gesture and a tasty experience.

After the movie finished, it was nearing ten o’clock at night, and each of the girls meandered upstairs to their rooms. Surprisingly, they each seemed to have forgotten about you, and left you all by yourself on the couch in the living room. You couldn’t really blame them, as this was only the first night for the three girls living under the same roof as a tiny like yourself. Your existence hadn’t become fully routine for them yet. Thankfully, it wasn’t too cold in the living room, and the couch cushion was nice and comfy, so you easily fell asleep.

*****

You awoke to Quinn standing above you, saying your name and lightly pushing the couch cushion with her foot to shake you awake. When you sat up groggily, she seemed to smile somewhat at your disheveled appearance, before switching back to her usual apathetic expression.

“Breakfast in the kitchen.” She said, jerking her head to motion towards the kitchen. She then sauntered away, leaving you to fulfill your morning obligations yourself. This way of treatment was still foreign to you, but there was something empowering about a giantess letting you act completely on your own.

After getting dressed and freshening up, you trekked over to the kitchen, narrowly avoiding Morgan’s pounding feet as she strode to the front door. You would’ve hated to get trampled under her sneakers as she left for the gym, so you were lucky you’d leapt to the side in time. You were doubly lucky Avery was still asleep too, as you had no doubt, she’d find a few to screw this morning up for you in that ditzy, bubbly way of hers.

Climbing up onto the kitchen table, you found that Quinn had set you aside some crackers and a shot glass of apple juice to drink from. Giving her an appreciative thumbs up, you dug into your meal, easily satisfying your hunger before you’d even finished off all of the crackers. Quinn didn’t say anything during the meal, but you caught her staring at you twice.

Finished eating, Quinn lifted up a duffel bag of her own onto the table, and gestured to an unzipped pocket on the side. “Get in. Easiest way to carry you, Hunter.”

“Sure thing.” You nodded, obliging the black-haired giantess. Scrambling up into the pocket, you fit snuggly inside. You watched the outside world disappear as Quinn zipped it up, and then everything began to swing and shake as Quinn shouldered the bag and headed for the door. In almost any other circumstance, this would terrify you, but you felt strangely at peace with placing your trust in your new roommate.

You felt your bag being set down on the passenger’s seat, and then the car start up. It was a bit boring in the bag, but surprisingly comfy, and one hundred percent safe. The drive to the beach took a little over a half hour, but finally you heard the car stop. Quinn picked the bag back up, and gently patted the pocket you were in.

“We’re here. Sanderson Beach.” She explained, and if you listened closely enough, you could hear the seagulls and the waves in the distance. “I need to go to the employee locker room to change, and then I’ll take you to the office to meet with Brigitte.”

You pounded back against Quinn’s hand as a sign of understanding, earning yourself the quietest and quickest of laughs you’d ever heard, before your giantess carrier headed off to the locker room. You couldn’t do much but keep waiting in the pocket, but you obviously knew why. In fact, you began to feel both embarrassed and intrigued by the fact that Quinn was now carrying you into the women’s locker room. You had never in your life been in one.

Ten minutes of mostly silence passed, though you heard Quinn give a muffled ‘hello’ to someone else in the locker room with her. Finally, your pocket was unzipped, and you were quickly grabbed up by Quinn’s giant, soft hand, her fingers enveloping you as she retrieved you. You were taken out of the bag and placed down on one of those hard-wooden benches common in locker rooms, and found yourself staring up at the black-haired giantess.

All rational thought fled your mind. Your jaw openly dropped, and your knees felt weak. Quinn had been unfathomably attractive upon first meeting her, but this was on a whole other level. While you’d been in the bag, she’d changed into what you could only assume was her lifeguard uniform. Though it was only a simple red one-piece bikini at the end of the day, the very sight of it rocked your world.

Quinn’s heavily abundant chest was wildly pronounced, as her gigantic breasts strained against the tight fabric of the bikini. The bikini clung to Quinn’s body like a second skin (at a guess, it was a size too small for the curvaceous girl), and showed off so much of her porcelain smooth flesh. Every time Quinn so much as shifted slightly, her boobs jiggled, and the word ‘LIFEGUARD’ which was printed across her chest was stretched and distorted to a comical degree.

Noticing your extremely obvious stare, Quinn frowned and crossed her arms, succeeding only in squishing her abundant breasts more prominently. “Wow, perv. I thought you were better than that, Hunter.”

You hastily clamped your jaw shut and stammered out a defense. “I-I just didn’t k-know you had changed! Caught me off guard!”

“It was the only spare uniform close to my size that they had.” Quinn sighed. “That’s why it’s so…” She cut herself off, and a faint color flared up in her cheeks. “A-anyway…it sucks, but whatever. Doesn’t bother me that much.”

“I think you look really great!” You said, smiling (and secretly praying that a compliment was the right course of action here).

Quinn quirked her mouth in a show of disbelief. “What?”

“I said you look great! Really!” You nodded enthusiastically.

Quinn seemed to debate whether you were being sincere or not for another second, and then finally smiled very softly. The blush had returned to her cheeks. “Th-thanks, Hunter.”

Grabbing up her bag, Quinn effortlessly tied her short hair back and out of her eyes, then turned to put her bag into the locker behind her. For the second time in a row, your breath caught in your throat, and your jaw fell back open again.

If Quinn was impressive from the front, her backside was a heaven all onto itself. Her humongous derriere was impossibly alluring in her one-piece, each plump but doughy cheek perfectly sculpted into a big bubble booty. The one-piece left most of Quinn’s creamy cheeks exposed, and it squeezed her ass so tight that the slightest movement shook it like an irresistible bowl of jelly. You desperately wished for nothing else than to leap into its pillowy embrace, this butt to end all butts bigger and more entrancing than any on the planet, in your books.

Oblivious to your staring, Quinn put her bag into her locker, then turned back to pick you up. Holding you in her hand, she walked out of the locker room and to the office. As she walked, you found it nigh impossible to not stare at her bountiful bosom or bodacious booty bounce and sway as she walked. Quinn was on a whole other level of thickness and beauty, and it was a shame she seemed oblivious to that. You also took note of how her one-piece seemed to keep riding up her butt crack, revealing even more of her ass. That whole ‘size too small’ issue was causing her a wedgie she had to keep picking out.

At the office, Quinn introduced you to the chief lifeguard of Sanderson Beach, Brigitte. Brigitte was a twenty-five-year-old woman whose standout features were her fiery mane of red hair and her pronounced muscles and defined abs. She was alluringly muscled, fit but still feminine. Her own one-piece fit much more naturally than Quinn’s, but she was still decently curvy under it. Her smile was award-winning.

“So, little dude, it’s a job you want?” Brigitte asked, still smiling at you. It was a bit intimidating, how closely she was leaning in towards Quinn’s hand to look at you.

“Uh…yes! Yes, ma’am! Any job you need, I’ll do it.” You proudly declared.

Brigitte grinned. “Love the attitude, man! I’ll hold you to that.” She stood back to her full height of 6’2”, and walked out from behind her desk. From what you’d gathered, she spent most days handling office affairs. “Let’s see…it’s sudden to throw on another new lifeguard. We already have three others on shift today…”

Quinn mused. “With three lifeguard towers overlooking the beach, we can always use more eyes.”

“True.” Brigitte agreed. “Tell ya what, Hunter. Do me proud for one whole week, and you’ve got a guaranteed position. Deal?”

“Absolutely!” You said, shaking the red head’s extended finger as a show of signing off on this new job. What’s your first task?
1153.title: First Day at the Beach

choices: A drowning girl screams for help, and Quinn rushes off alone to save her.
A drowning girl screams for help, but Quinn brings you with her as she goes.

11531.content:
“Well, if testing you is what we’re going with…” Brigitte tapped her chin, and looked at Quinn. Her eyes lit up. “Quinn! Take Hunter with you to the middle tower. He’ll be your partner for today’s shift, and maybe the rest of the week.”

Quinn nodded, understanding. “Of course.”

You smiled broadly. “Sounds like a plan to me, boss!”

Brigitte laughed at your bravado. “Alright, then get going, you two! Guard some lives!”

You and Quinn both nodded again, before you hopped up onto Quinn’s palm. Bracing yourself, you held steady as your black-haired roommate strolled out of the office and onto the beach proper. The sun was blisteringly hot, but thankfully you and Quinn had both put on some sunscreen (Quinn in particular had lathered up to the extreme). There was also an occasional breeze that felt quite good, especially on your miniscule body.

Quinn strolled purposefully towards the middle tower, which you could see was not too far away. It was a standard lifeguard lookout post, about twelve feet off the ground. That was only half what you were noticing, however, as your attention had shamefully wandered back to Quinn herself. In full motion, her gigantic breasts were once more bouncing in an eye-catching manner, and her one-piece was again riding up her massive booty, revealing even more of it to the world. You were hardly the only one staring too, as Quinn was drawing the eyes of everyone she walked by.

Even still, she seemed oblivious to the adoration of the beach goers, or her own sex appeal. Your roommate and new partner merely kept sauntering on, eventually reaching the bottom of the lifeguard tower. Without a word to you, she cupped her hand and tossed you into the sky. You screamed out in surprise, flew into the air, and then crashed back down up atop the tower, landing in a slightly squishy heap on the floor of the tower.

While you reformed, Quinn effortlessly scaled the ladder up onto the tower, and stood atop it seconds later. She spotted you immediately, and scooped you back up into her hand, then placed you on the railing that served as a barrier around the top of the tower. With you in place, she sank down into the lone chair, which looked to be made of uncomfortable hard plastic. You also couldn’t help but note how Quinn’s humongous ass just barely squeezed into the chair.

After a moment of silence, you spoke up. “So…this is the tower. What do we do now?” You looked at your new partner eagerly, and though she stared back apathetically at first, your enthusiasm for your new job rubbed off just a bit on her, and she soothed her expression.

“Not much, really.” Quinn shrugged. “If someone asks for help, we help them. If someone starts screaming out in the water, we save them. Otherwise…” She gestured in a circle. “This is our post for the rest of the shift. Get comfy.”

You laughed at her blunt explanation, and sat down on the wooden railing. It was smooth wood, so no splinters, thankfully. In fact, you bet that you were more comfortable sitting on the railing than Quinn was in her seat. Though it was early in the day, the sun had been bearing down for hours, and the plastic was probably quite broiling, not to mention how the chair pinched and poked at Quinn’s hips and back. You had to believe that it was built for lifeguard’s with much less developed proportions than the black-haired giantess.

The next twenty minutes were fairly uneventful. No one asked for help, no one screamed for a savior. The sounds of the beach were just the crashing of the waves, the laughing of the beach goers, the occasional windy breeze, and the cawing of seagulls. You passed the time with Quinn by asking her about some of her favorite memories working here. She was her usual cagey self for a bit, but she began to open up more as time went by. It was pretty fun.

Eventually, the fun came to an end, and a faint voice called out from the bottom of the tower. “Hey! Miss! Can you help me find my phone? I swear, I just had it!”

Quinn hopped to her feet instantly, and walked over to the railing, peering down at the young girl who had asked for help. “Of course. I’ll be right there.” She replied. She then looked back to you, forcing you to quickly clamp your open jaw shut, hoping Quinn hadn’t just caught you watching her bubble butt jiggle and shake due to how fast she had stood up.

From the way Quinn’s eyes narrowed in annoyance, and the way she reached a hand back to readjust her wedgied one-piece, you knew that she had caught you.

Trying to not address it, you stammered out. “U-uh…want me to come with?”

Surprisingly, Quinn shook her head. “No, not this time. It’ll take too long. Hold down the fort.” She said, and then turned on her heel without another word. In one effortless motion, Quinn flipped around onto the ladder, and descended it out of sight.

All alone, you went back to scanning the beach, looking for anything that might be amiss, or anyone who might need help. There were a huge number of people at the beach, laughing, tanning, playing volleyball, swimming, and just generally enjoying themselves. For one blissful moment, you felt that this job was truly the best thing to ever happen to you, or any tiny, for that matter. It was perfect.

The illusion of perfection shattered a moment later, when a squawking seagull dive-bombed through the air, coming to a screeching landing on the tower railing right beside you. You screamed and backed away, the giant bird like a mythical creature of death at your size. The seagull eyed you curiously, and took a step closer.

Not wanting to end up the meal for some bird, you blindly leapt from the railing towards the inside of the tower, hoping it wouldn’t follow you. You hadn’t exactly looked where you were jumping, though, and you ended up landing right in the lifeguard chair. The fall slightly squished your legs, but the real thing you noticed first was the burning sensation of the hot plastic. It felt like you had landed in lava, it was almost overwhelmingly hot.

A quick glance told you that the seagull had given up and flown away, allowing you to breath a sigh of relief and focus on reforming. Your feet had flattened out and stuck to the plastic, the sticky nature of your body no doubt enhanced by how searingly hot the plastic was. Almost as overbearing as the temperature was the residual scent of Quinn’s body wash mixed with her sweat. It was both gross and appealing, and that fact made it all the weirder.

Unfortunately, you had only just reformed one foot when the worst possible thing happened: Quinn appeared, having finished helping the young girl down below. She scaled the ladder with ease, and then approached her chair. You still couldn’t move, and could only look up at her in fear as she towered above you. Nightmare scenarios of her not noticing you and sitting down ran through your mind, but she actually spotted you right away.

Hands on her hips, Quinn frowned. “…what are you doing, Hunter? That’s not your seat.”

You held up your hands, willing your right foot to stop sticking to the chair. “I-I know, I know! I’m sorry, Quinn. A seagull flew by and scared me off the railing. This is where I fell.”

Quinn’s look of contempt told you that she didn’t believe you, but there was a hint of uncertainty in her eyes. “Uh huh. You landed right where I’m supposed to sit. Honestly, I should already BE sitting, even if you are there. It’s not where you’re supposed to be, after all.”

“It’s the truth, honest! Please, Quinn, it won’t happen again!” You pleaded with your giantess lifeguard partner. “I’ll be more careful.”

An agonizingly long moment passed before Quinn closed her eyes and sighed. Reaching down, she plucked you up from her seat and returned you to the railing. She then sat back down, her butt audibly clapping against the plastic as she plopped into her chair. A grimace crossed your face, as visions of you being trapped under all of that played out in your mind.

You gave Quinn a big, genuine smile. “Thank you, Quinn. And I’m sorry.”

Quinn shook her head. “No, I believe you, about the seagull. That isn’t your fault, much. It would’ve been wrong to punish you for it.” She sighed, and you were about to speak again when she held up a finger, shushing you. “BUT, if it happens again, I won’t save you. You have to take care of yourself, Hunter, or you’ll always be as weak and frail as people say that tinies are. You won’t grow more dependable if I baby you every day during this job.”

You took stock of her words, and nodded. “Of course. You’re right.”

Quinn smiled faintly, and then was back to full business mode. “So if I see you on my chair again before I sit down…” She shrugged. “Don’t let me find you on my chair, is what I’m saying.”

“Roger that!” You saluted, earning a barely audible chuckle from the black-haired giantess. Then, the two of you went back to looking out over the beach. Your shift as partners continued.
