"I'm sorry mam it seems there is no signature of a Tony on this license which makes the whole document wortless, legally speaking of course" you said smiling and drunk of your own self esteem. " I will have to call my boss to further inspect this anomaly, I'm sure when we ask Tony he will explain everything" you said
In the blink of an eye the woman grabed you with light speed and you found yourself right in front of her angry face.
"Oh I dont think so my dear. Do you see this woman there?" she asked pointing at a huge curvy black woman in a skimpy blue bikini walking towards your spot and waiving with her arms to greet. Even from this perspective you could see that her assets , especially her butt were giant in comparison to Rachels
"This is Isabella, my dearest friend and by coincidence she is a notary which can confirm my story about tonys free choice to be a thong for me. " she explained to you with a huge smile on her face.
"She was responsible for all the paper work I had to do before I could get Tony where I wanted. So here is the deal little man either you stay silent about all of these accusations with the tower and tony, or maybe a new Usage License appears with your name on it and I promise you that the "For everyone to use"- Box will be crossed. I'm sure Isabella would gladly be of help for your wish. And the way I see it you would also make a great thong but I guess you will be the wrong size for a woman like me" she said with a telling expression on her face while turning her eyes to Isabell.

Now you were in a double windmill. either you give in and wont have an explanation for the lost tower or you will have to deal with a corrupt notary and her evil friend leading to a Usage Licence for yourself. "What shall I do either way I'm fucked up, the question is... is my well being more important than tonys? Noone will investigate his status as a thong without you.
1153211.title: You wriggle out and try to make amends with the...

choices: Rachel backs down and releases you *and* Tony
Rachel backs down and releases you, but escapes with Tony
Rachel smirks and calls your bluff
Rachel reacts and tries to squish you before you can call for help
11532112.content:
You swallowed hard within Rachel's grip. You thought back to everything that had happened since you moved in with your three new roommates and you realized that Quinn was right. You had lived a very fortunate protected life up until now. Other tiny men, like little Tony for example, weren't so lucky. This was your moment to show that you could stand up for yourself and for other tinies. If you couldn't stand up to a bully like Rachel, you didn't deserve this job in the first place.

"No Rachel," you begin as calmly as you can manage. "There won't be a new usage license for me today. You see, my bosses aren't stupid. They didn't send me out here alone. I have a panic button I can push and another lifeguard - not a tiny one - and my boss will be here within moments. I didn't need to use it before, but with a threat like that you're forcing my hand," you lie thru your teeth as you squirm within her fist. You make it clear that you're not squirming to get away, but squirming to reach for something.

Rachel's eyes widen. Does she believe you and back down or does she see thru your lie?
11532112.title: The Greater Good

choices: A team effort, going to help you figure out what is happening.
A second day of work, albeit with much different duties.
A relative who you haven't seen in a while was told about your license...
115321122.content:
You were overwhelmed upon realizing the bluff that you just laid down. But even though it was your first day, it was your duty as a lifeguard to protect the lives of any tiny guys at the beach. It would have weighed heavily on your conscience if you just abandoned him to be imprisoned in this arrogant woman’s ass. Clearly you figured that she, with the help of her friend, had the ability to create counterfeit usage licenses based on the muffled screams of the guy acting as her thong.

But even knowing that fact, you would never be able to forgive yourself if you let this fellow guy Tony suffer in his current predicament. You cursed your stupidly strong sense of empathy, knowing that like always it would only lead you to trouble.

“I’m sorry miss, but I just can’t let this slide. This usage license clearly isn’t official and you know it.” You said up to her, still pretending to find this mysterious panic button that you claimed to have on you. From in between two of her fingers, pinching you like a twig, it was admittedly hard to feign confidence. You saw the malice growing in this giantess’s eyes as you challenged her, strengthening the pit of nerves that you felt in your stomach. You knew firsthand that directly challenging a normal sized girl as a one inch tall guy was consistently the dumbest choice that you could make, but for some reason you just couldn’t let this situation go.

To your absolute surprise Rachel opened up her fist and simply dropped you onto the sand below! You landed with a thud inaudible to any regular sized people, immediately trying to straighten and reform the legs that she squished in her grip. Nevertheless, it seemed like your plan had worked!

“Fine, you little tattletale. Messing with you isn’t worth the risk of you actually calling over someone who has real power.” Rachel said while gathering her things! It seemed like you had actually won your battle! Your confidence soared briefly, thinking on your feet actually got you out of a jam for once. But then Rachel continued, “My friend and I will find somewhere else on this stupid beach to tan, but not before we find another lifeguard and ask allllll about you. I’m sure that my notary friend finding out all of your personal details won’t end up badly for you at all!” Rachel’s indirect threat struck fear further into your heart as she then leaned down, lowered her sunglasses, and looked directly into your eyes. Her enormous breasts threatened to spill out of her bikini top, but you were far too terrified to even pay attention to them at a time like this.

“I know you think you might have won or something, twerp, but you didn’t. Not only am I not giving up my little thong, but let’s just say your life is going to get a lot more difficult in the near future.” Rachel smirked before finishing, “Even though I may not be the one dishing out the punishment to your tiny ass, you better pray that the other women in your life really like you, because if they don’t… well you’ll find out!” As she concluded her speech, Rachel stood up and shot you a final wink before spinning around and walking away. She signaled to her friend Isabella that they would need to find a new spot, prompting a quick look of confusion from the woman before she simply shrugged her shoulders and kept walking. As the two women walked further into the distance you cursed the sad life of that guy, Tony, watching as he was chewed up between the callous woman’s butt cheeks. You took another moment to assess your surroundings and you lamented the state of the men’s beach section. The simple action of that jerk of a woman sitting down in the sand practically wiped out everything that was set up to help you.

Looking back once more to make sure that the two menaces of women were actually leaving, you gulped with fear upon remembering Rachel’s threat. If her friend really was a notary like she said, could she really write a usage license for you without your consent?! As you had that thought your eyes found the two, now a good distance away, and they seemed to be talking to Brigitte. Rachel clearly pointed directly at you and the tiny guy’s section, sharing a few words with your boss of all people. Your eyes opened wide, as you finally saw Brigitte split from the two immediately begin walking towards you. Now panicked, you frantically wondered what that malicious woman may have said to your boss. If she bad mouthed you enough you wouldn’t be surprised if you were fired on the spot!

Brigitte’s long powerful steps covered the vast stretch of beach between you and her in no time. What may have been a multiple day hike for you was only a minute or so for the strong giantess. Your nerves were about to overwhelm you as Brigitte walked straight up to you, surprisingly noticing you next to the remnants of your shattered lifeguard tower.

“Hunter!” She exclaimed, intimidating you once more. But suddenly she broke into a huge smile, “Those two women over there just raved to me about how helpful you were to them! They said they really appreciated your hard work and were asking all about you! They even asked for your home address which I thought was a bit strange at first, but they said they wanted to send you a gift or something. Either way, keep up the good work. You’ve already surpassed my expectations for you, and the busy part of the day should just about be ending so the rest of the day should be a breeze.” Brigitte shot you a big thumbs up before turning and walking away, presumably to check on Quinn and the other lifeguards.

You couldn’t believe your ears. Not only did Rachel and Isabella not try to get you fired, but they actually praised you. On one hand you were happy, but on the other hand you felt incredibly uneasy with how that whole situation went down. What else did that crazy girl and her friend have in store for you?

The rest of your day went miraculously smoothly. True to Brigitte’s claim, the rush slowed down significantly, a welcome change for you. You sadly had to sit in the sand since your lifeguard tower was destroyed, but somehow no other life-threatening events happened at all until the end of your shift. At the end of the day, Quinn picked you up and took you home, carrying you in the pocket of her bag once more. Part of you wanted to talk to her on the trip back but you didn’t want to push the envelope with your new roommate. She seemed a bit standoffish, even though you could tell that there was more to her than that, but either way risking annoying her didn’t seem like the best move.

Your luck continued into the evening, as you and your three roommates ordered chinese food and had a remarkably unremarkable dinner. Nobody slurped you up along with their noodles, or threw you into the trash accidentally, or even squashed you at all! You had a genuinely nice night, each telling one another about their respective jobs. It was fantastic to say the least. Even when the three girls left you downstairs without figuring out your sleeping arrangements just like the night before, you didn’t mind one bit. You had hope that you would figure it out soon enough, but until then the cushioned couch was more than sufficient. Eventually, you drifted off into dreamland, thinking about how your one inch tall life might turn out normal just yet.

You awoke in the morning to Morgan standing over you, holding a letter with your name on it. You rubbed the sleep out of your eyes and looked closer and saw that it was stamped with the logo of the C.T.C or the Center for Tiny Citizenship!

“This looks serious, Hunter. You want me to open it for you?” Morgan said, with evident concern in her voice. Having just woke up, you simply nodded. Morgan dug her finger into the envelope and gently opened it. When she pulled out the two of you recognized the paper immediately. Tinies and regular sized girls alike knew what it was upon first glance, considering it was likely the single most impactful law that had been passed in the last half century. Both you and Morgan’s eyes went wide, as she read out loud “Usage License for General Use… Hunter Woods” Morgan spun the paper around immediately you saw a clearly forged version of your signature, along with the words General Use instead of a specific woman’s name on the opposite side. Down at the bottom you saw in fine print, “notarized by Isabella Brooks”. Your entire world was shattered in an instant. Those crazy women did it. Not only did you have an official usage license, but a General Use one to boot. This meant that any woman could use you without needing documentation of their own. Effectively, if a cruel enough woman found out about this she could destroy your life as a human being in an instant and subject you to a life of use.

Not being able to handle this atomic bomb of news so early in the morning, you felt yourself get light headed and faint!

When you awoke soon after, what was happening?

(Some/all of the girls all take a sick day and take you straight to the C.T.C. to get to the bottom of your random Usage License)

(You wake up in Quinn’s bag, with her taking you to work just like yesterday since she didn’t want to be late. Little did you know but your employer gets automatically notified if a tiny guy acquires a usage license while currently employed. Brigitte may force Quinn to use you as a swimsuit to replace her too-small uniform)

(You wake up to a knock on the door and it is a relative who you haven’t seen in a while, eager to use you)
115321122.title: Issued a Counterfeit Usage License

choices: Morgan keeps her grip
Thrown towards the bus driver
Thrown behind Morgan
1153211221.content:
You awake to the sight of Morgan’s concerned face staring down at you with a look of concern, which softened when she saw you moving.
“Avery, Quinn! He’s awake!” Her face was soon flanked by the equally enormous faces of Quinn and Avery.
You saw the look of concern on Avery’s face change to her usual carefree smile once she saw you were awake.
Quinn was showing her usual apathetic expression, but you could see the worry in her eyes.

You suddenly became aware of the sounds of many different conversations coming from all around you. This made you take a look around and you and realise that you were currently on a bus, with you and your roommates occupying the back seats.
You looked back to your roommates in confusion before Avery, noticing the confused look on your face, spoke up.
“We all took the day off to take you to the C.T.C and help you get rid of that general usage license!” Avery’s exuberant personality and loud voice drew the looks of a few of the other women on the bus, many of their eyes drawing to you at the mention of your usage license. Several of them gave you flirty looks, most of them gave you looks that made you very uncomfortable. You were speechless as Avery broadcasted to the whole bus that they could freely use you and the law would be on their side.
Morgan and Quinn quickly shushed Avery who didn’t even seem to realise what she had done wrong, but the damage was already done. You could feel many sets of eyes on you, including the bus driver, who you could see stealing glances back at your group in her rear view mirror.
“What? It’s not as if anyone could take Hunter from the three of us, we just need to keep an eye on him,” Avery huffed defensively as she saw the irritated looks on the other girl’s faces because of her outburst.
“So Hunter, the plan is to walk in to the C.T.C building and demand a meeting with the woman who notarised your license and try to straighten this out. If not we can try and threaten legal action against them, although that might be a difficult route since these usage licenses are kinda hard to get rid of from what I hear. Plus none of us really have that much money to pay a good lawyer, so let’s hope it doesn’t come to that,” Morgan’s eyes seemed to sadden as she explained how difficult that getting rid of this license could be. You felt yourself falling deeper into panic the more you thought about it as well. The only thing keeping you even slightly calm was the fact that all three of your roommates were here to protect you.
“Our stop should be coming up soon, so sit tight Hunter,” Avery gave you a small smile, which then faded to her usual neutral expression once she realised she was smiling.
The bus journey passed uneventfully, the chatter between your roommates drifted away from your situation, which helped ease your nerves. However as the girls chatted you couldn’t shake the feeling of several sets of eyes still on you, many of the women on the bus hadn’t taken their eyes off of you since Avery’s outburst, even the bus driver was still stealing glances at you when she wasn’t focusing on the road. Eventually Quinn and Morgan also noticed the stares, both of them giving you a look of reassurance as Avery continued to chat.

Eventually the bus started to approach the stop closest to the C.T.C office building. Quinn, Morgan and Avery stood up, with Morgan at the front holding you.
Many of the women who were watching you lost interest when they saw you leaving the bus, except for one, the driver.
As your group walked through the isle you saw her glance at you and smirk. Before you could even contemplate what was happening she pressed on the breaks, jolting the bus to a halt in the stop. Morgan stumbled forward with you in her hand as she tried to keep her grip on you. Does she succeed?

1) Yes, Morgan manages to keep a hold of you and you all get off the bus as quickly as possible. Morgan and Quinn glaring at the bus driver as you do.

2) No, and you go flying forward towards the bus driver, exactly as she planned.

3) No, you go flying backwards towards one of the other passengers, or towards Quinn or Avery.
1153211221.title: The journey to the C.T.C building

choices: Had agreed to check into a special psychiatric ward for MDPD sufferers.
Had checked into a meditation retreat which helps tinies find their purpose.
Had agreed to undertake direct MDPD treatment with Rachel herself.
11532112211.content:
[This chapter was written in collaboration with kla]

The sudden lurch of the bus did throw Morgan forward, in accordance with the driver’s plan, but she retained enough presence of mind to realise the danger of loosing you as her fingers clamped down like a vice. For a moment it seemed that the brunette was going to crash to the bus’s floor herself, but in the next instance her fall was halted as Quinn’s arm wrapped around her waist and held her steady, the pale girl’s free hand gripping the nearest hand hold and managing to stay steady even as Avery collided with her back with a small squeak of surprise. You meanwhile were being squeezed nearly to death as Morgan’s hand compressed you like a piece of putty, your roommate too preoccupied catching her breath and glaring daggers at the driver to notice your plight.

With the immediate danger passed the three hurried off the bus, though not without Quinn flipping off the driver in the process. Several of the other passengers still eyed the four of you as the vehicle pulled away, but that particularly threat was over for now. Once on solid ground, Avery made a show of throwing her arms around Quinn’s shoulders and thanking her for the save, only to laugh as her roommate shoved her off. The pinkette then shifted her gaze to her sister and you, a cheshire smile crossing her lips as she witnessed her twin’s fingers nervously playing with the squishy mass of flesh you had been reduced to. “My my, having some fun with Hunter are you Morgs?”

“Huh?” Eyes flitting down, Morgan gasped as she realised what she had done to you, quickly loosening her grip and inverting her hand so you were sitting in her palm, squished extremities slowly coming back together as you tried to catch your breath. “Oh God, I’m sorry Hunter. I just didn’t want to drop you. I wasn’t paying attention. I just…” She trailed off as she brought you closer to bump against her chest in what you assumed was intended as a comforting gesture. It went south fast though as Avery giggled and threw her arms around you both, momentarily crushing you between the twins’ chest before Quinn pulled her off with an eye roll and shove her towards the nearby building. Letting out a relieved breath, your current holder smiled down at you and followed.

By the time the four of you entered the imposingly large C.T.C building, you had managed to reform enough to stand up straight in Morgan’s palm, trying not to feel intimidated at the many women standing around in the expansive foyer, and wondering if there was a single man working here. Thankfully, your reticence didn’t slow Quinn down, as the curvaceous young woman made a beeline for the front desk and placed her hands down firmly in front of a bored looking receptionist. “We’re here to see one of your workers. First name Isabella.” The receptionist moved to respond, but your roommate spoke over her. “She issued a licence to my friend Hunter Woods. Without his consent.”

The receptionist appeared taken aback, surprise, and possibly offence, flashing across her face as she contemplated the outlandish allegation. Her jaw set as she prepared to respond, but she was interrupted by the sound of clicking heels as none other than Rachel herself strode out to meet you. “Hunter! I’m so glad you could make it, though I suppose I shouldn’t be surprised. You’ve always been one of my more punctual patients.” The smile that accompanied those words was warm and welcoming, and for a moment you were so shocked that her words didn’t register. When they finally did you found yourself wracking your brain in an attempt to determine just what she was doing.

Quinn meanwhile was immediately on guard against this new arrival, her own voice drowning out your first attempt to speak. “Who are you?” A raised eyebrow was her initial response, before Rachel turned to face the pale girl with a small frown. “I might ask you the same question. I don’t believe we’ve met, so I am curious what you are doing with my patient.” Not liking where this was going you tried to speak up, only to be drowned out once again by Quinn as she growled out her next words. “We’re his roommates. Now what exactly do you mean when you say ‘patient’?”

Rachel cocked her head at that, her expression seemingly thoughtful as she feigned considering the younger girl’s words. “It means that I’m his psychiatrist.” She tapped her chin. “Hunter never mentioned having roommates before. Is this a recent occurrence?” Whether the sinister woman was guessing or had seriously done her research you didn’t know, but Avery’s rapid nodding was all the answer she needed as she made a tutting noise with her tongue. “I see. Hunter you really should share these kind of things with me. It may be relevant to your treatment.” Her hand came to her mouth as she gasped, and just for an instant you saw something malicious flash in her gaze. “Oh no, please don’t tell me you forgot again Hunter. This is serious. Things might be getting worse.”

All at once you began to see the sinister game that Rachel was playing, realising that she had known you would come here and had prepared herself accordingly. Finally given the chance to speak you raged against her wicked intent. “You liar! Don’t listen to her guys. I’ve never seen a psychiatrist in my life, let alone her!” Though if you were honest, there were times that you could have used one.

Your attempts to continue were cut off as Rachel gasped dramatically once more, her hand moving to her chest as she faked an expression of deep concern and took a step towards you. “Oh dear, it’s worst than I thought. These slips of yours are happening far too often now Hunter. It may be a sign that you’re heading for a complete breakdown.” She shook her head sadly, though simultaneously sighed as if in deep relief. “Still, I’m so glad you decided to check-in when you did. Who knows when your next moment of lucidity might have been. At this point I think we cannot act quickly enough.”

You tried to scream out again that she’s lying, but your ability to breath was suddenly robbed from you as Morgan closed her fingers tightly around you in an unconscious attempt to shield you from the outside world. Not paying attention to her hand, the brunette eyed Rachel wearingly as she half-hid behind Quinn’s larger frame. “What do you mean ‘check-in’? Is Hunter in some kind of trouble?”

Seeing that her advance was putting the girls on edge, Rachel stopped and raised her hands in the universal sign of surrender. A hand moved to massage her brow as she adopted a troubled expression and glanced first at you and then at the three girls standing in her way. “Look. I really shouldn’t be sharing a client’s diagnosis with non-family members, but…” A sigh. “You do seem like good friends, and given Hunter’s current state of mind, I suppose I owe you the basics.” Leaning back against the receptionist’s desk, she folded her arms beneath her impressive chest and made a show of considering her next words. “Hunter here has been seeing me for some years now. Like many of his kind he is unfortunately suffering from a condition known as MDPD, or Minun Dissociative Personality Disorder. Minun being another term for what you would know as tinies. In Hunter’s case, his condition was most likely brought on by some unfortunate experiences in his childhood.”

Quinn, at least, looked like she had questions, but Rachel continued before your roommate could voice them. “In some cases, like Hunter’s, the personality switches in MDPD sufferers is known to cause temporary and often specific memory loss, including even complete denial of the condition and of any memories gained while under the affect of the core personality.” She gestured at you, still unable to speak thanks to Morgan’s tight grip, as if your prior words were proof enough. “I had hoped that he was getting better, but if he can’t even remember me right now after so many years of work, it may actually be getting worse.” A sad smile accompanied another shake of her head. “I suppose the stress of leaving home and trying to break into the workforce was just too much.”

Standing once more, Rachel fixed a smile on her face as she spread her arms as if in triumph. “Still. All is not lost. I approached Hunter a few week ago with the suggestion of a rather radical treatment. I had hoped it wouldn’t be needed, but Hunter disagreed, and it looks like he was right to do so.” You glared up at her as she smiled down at you, the tiniest of twitches at the edge of her lips the only sign that there was anything other than genuine kindness and concern behind that gaze.

Morgan’s fingers slackened and you tried to call out, but the next thing you knew you were forcibly torn from the brunette’s grasp and pressed forcibly into the chest of her twin sister, as Avery pulled you into a fierce hug fuelled by concern. Much to your discontent, the young model had bought fully into Rachel’s story, her eyes misting with tears as she crushed you against her assets. “Hunter, I had no idea. You should have told us if you were suffering. We would have done anything to help you.” You tried to protest but your mouth was clogged by cloth and boob, and what muffled noises you could make were drowned out as Morgan argued with the shorter girl about who should hold you.

While the twin’s turned their attention to fawning over you, Quinn fixed narrowed eyes on the woman who was trying to destroy your life, as of yet unsatisfied by her attempt at an explanation. Even if she hadn’t known you long, she’d seen enough to doubt you were truly suffering from this MDPD. “What kind of treatment, exactly, are we talking about? And how does any of this explain why you issued Hunter with a general use licence. How exactly was that meant to help him huh?”

Rachel sighed, looking for all the world like a weary retail worker dealing with a difficult customer, before finally fixing a look of concern on her face and advising Quinn that you…
11532112211.title: Unexpected Encounter at the C.T.C

choices: The nurses catch you successfully and you are carried off to the ward.
The nurses miss and you bounce off their chests, loose in the C.T.C building.
Quinn grabs you mid-air, not believing Rachel’s story, and flees.
115321122111.content:
[This chapter was written in collaboration with kla]

“Hunter agreed to sign a general usage licence so that he could undergo special treatment at a psychiatric ward for MCPD sufferers. They use cutting edge treatments to help disassociated tinies find their true personality, whether that be as a human…” She paused, smiling gently. “…or as an object serving the important purpose of assisting others in their day-to-day lives.” Quinn appeared shocked by this information, and Rachel continued on before she could voice another objection. “You need a licence to attend, so that they can carry out the necessary treatments in full compliance with the law. Honestly, I was worried Hunter was taking too big a step too soon, but now that I’ve seen him like this I’m glad he signed all the necessary paperwork while he was still thinking straight.”

Having tuned back in when Rachel started talking, both Avery and Morgan were saddened by what they heard, the shorter twin’s grip thankfully loosening enough for you to finally shout out another protest. “I told you she’s lying! I’ve never even heard of MCP-whatever. The first time I met this crazy bitch was at the beach yesterday!” You were aware that you were loosing your cool, but you could already see the future this horrible woman had planned for you unfolding before your eyes, and you would be damned if you allowed her to send you off to some institution who knows where.

True to form, Rachel feigned ignorance, appearing taken aback by your harsh words but not responding in kind. “There’s no need for aggression Hunter.” She frowned, as if something had just occurred to her. “Oh dear. Before it was just memory loss, but if you’re saying you saw me at the beach then I’m afraid that your condition is deteriorating even more rapidly than we had feared. The creation of artificial memories is rare even in MDPD sufferers. You’re quite convinced it was me?”

“Stop lying!” You could see Quinn looking at you in concern now but you blocked it out, focusing on the threat in front of you. “I recall exactly what happened. You came to the beach without any care for the tinies, except maybe for that poor guy Tony who’d you unlawfully trapped as your thong! When I called you on your fake licence you and your friend Isabella threatened me with a fake licence of my own!” Your eyes darkened as you thought of the next part, the existential threat still hanging over you. “And you followed through didn’t you!? I have a goddamn licence now!!”

Ignoring the rest of your rant like a trained professional, Rachel zeroed in on a single key piece of information. “Tony? Hunter, I would never trap anyone as my thong against their will, least of all Tony.” You scoffed, and opened your mouth to protest, but were interrupted by her next words and actions. “Here, you can ask him yourself.” Caught off guard by the suggestion, you could only stare as the psychiatrist undid the first few buttons of her blouse and nonchalantly plunged a hand into her own cleavage. Seconds later she pulled out a disoriented looking tiny, who you didn’t recognise but could only presume to be Tony, last seen in the form of a thong. Rachel shot the little guy a smile with far too pronounced teeth. “Everyone, this is my handsome little husband. Dear, Hunter seems to think I took you to the beach as my thong. Do you have any idea what he’s talking about?”

You could see Tony shiver as his owner ran a finger down his spine, and instantly knew this would end badly for you. The others didn’t seem to notice however, as the clearly intimated tiny spoke up in a timid voice. “Of course not d-dear. You’ve never done something like t-that to me.” There was a twitch in the hand that held the little man and he hurried on. Dull eyes flashed to you with a spark of apology, and you smiled grimly in response. “Of course, we’ve met a couple of times when he’s received treatment from you dear, but certainly never as a t-thong.” You hated the idea of a fellow tiny selling you out, though if you were honest you could somewhat understand. In all likelihood he’d been Rachel’s possession for some time, and a chance at salvation was worth almost anything.

To your horror, the others were looking increasingly uncertain in their convictions now. Morgan was now looking at you with concern while Quinn had an unreadable look. Avery just cuddled you all the harder as she sniffed sadly, pressing you against her breasts and ignoring your attempts to struggle free. Before any of you could speak Rachel casually dropped Tony back into her cleavage, pushing him down between the massive orbs again before reaching over to grab some files from the front desk. “If you still aren’t convinced then here. Documented attendance by Mr Hunter Woods at my clinic for the last few years, as well as further documentation around his licensing application.”

Seeming more hesitant now, Quinn reached out and took the fabricated papers, eyes widening slightly as she flipped them open and started to read their contents. Beside her, Morgan crowded close so she could get a look as well, while Avery looked back to Rebecca, only to see the older woman holding out her hand with an expectant look. The young model looked hesitant, and you sent her a pleading look, but it was enough to stop her from wordlessly handing you over, wholly convinced that she was doing the right thing. Your other roommates looked up at the motion and eyes narrowed, but there was little they could do to slow things down now without causing a scene.

You wanted to shout out again in protest, but Rachel had more experience then you could know, and even as she smiled down at you with apparent warmth, the fingers that seemed to cradle your body pressed down with expertly precise force on your diaphragm, robbing you of breath. “Don’t worry Hunter. I know you must be really confused and scared right now, but I promise we’re going to get you the help that you need.” At those words Quinn finally seemed to regain some of her earlier determination and looked ready to intervene, but she was interrupted as the psychiatrist made a beckoning motion towards a group of women standing at the opposite end of the foyer.

Confused, your roommates turn to see who Rachel was motioning to, your own eyes following their shifted gazes and nearly bugging out when you saw who was approaching. Two woman, looking to be of similar age to yourself and your roommates, were heading across the room in your direction. Each was dressed in purple nursing scrubs, which clung tightly enough to their bodies to leave little to the imagination. To put it simply, each of them was stunningly beautiful. One a pale blond with hair down to the middle of her back, and the other a tanned woman with a long brunette braid. More importantly, each of them sported outrageous curves that could compete even with Quinn’s, while still appearing to maintain a level of tone that kept their prodigious assets firm and perky.

You were momentarily distracted from your dire predicament as you watched the two nurses bounce over, their massive chests actually bouncing off one another at one point as they hurried over to greet Rachel. Words failed you as their massive forms came to a stop just a few feet away, the brilliant smiles on their faces seeming to hold no ill-intent as they each looked down at you for a moment before focusing back on the woman who was intent to make your life a living hell. To her credit, the psychiatrist’s smile never slipped, even as she continued to weave her malicious web. “Hello girls. Thank you for coming on such short notice, but I’m afraid this is a rather serious case, and Hunter here needs all the care that he can get.” She raised you slightly so you could better look the two in the eye. “He will be staying in the ward until his condition improves. I hope you will be able to accommodate his particular needs, as you have so many others in the past.”

In the instant, the attention of both nurses shifted entirely to yourself, and for a moment everyone else seemed to fade away as you looked upon such radiant and benevolent expressions. It was the brunette that spoke up, though the blonde nodded along as she did so. “Hey there little guy. I’m Talia, and this is Emily.” The blonde gave you a little wave. “We’re going to take you somewhere where you can be safe and cared for okay. You’ll love the ward I promise. Us to, and all of the other girls as well. We’ll do everything we can to make sure you find your true calling.” Though the content of her words still chilled you, you couldn’t find it in yourself to doubt their sincerity, not with the way the two continued to beam at you. Like you were something precious to defend at all costs.

Mesmerised, you couldn’t even find the will to protest as Rachel finally loosened her grip. “You’ll find that his licencing arrangements are all in order. General use licence as per your usual clause. Indefinite term, though with the option to switch to a specific licence if required.” Her lips twisted into a small concerned frown. “Just be aware that he’s having a dissociative episode at the moment, so he may not be fully compliant. Hopefully he’ll calm down soon. If not, you may need to take more extreme measures to help him.” With that ominous threat hanging over you, you suddenly found yourself tossed casually into the air, sailing across the distance between Rachel and the nurses.

But do you reach the nurses unimpeded, and if so are you even caught smoothly?
115321122111.title: Sentenced to the Psychiatric Ward

choices: You succeed in getting free but must now navigate the room of nurses.
Talia reacts by stuffing you into her cleavage to keep you safe and secure.
Your escape attempt is interrupt as Dr Miller arrives for your evaluation.
1153211221111.content:
[This chapter was written in collaboration with kla]

Your airborne journey was short-lived as Emily’s soft hands quickly closed around you. Before you could even speak, she cradled you to her chest much as Avery had done, though with her more prodigious assets in play you found yourself quickly sinking into the warm embrace. A pale hand pressed flat against your back and held you in place, and for a moment you recalled some distant memory from your infancy when you had been held against your mother’s breast just like this. You weren’t a baby anymore though, and you could feel more than one part of yourself stiffen as your face turned violently red, though if the blonde noticed she made no attempt to loosen her hold.

Although the sound of Emily’s heartbeat now resonated in your eyes, you could hear the beginnings of a protest from Quinn, only for the raven-haired girl to be cut off as Talia interjected, expertly placing herself between her colleague and your roommates. “Fiends of Mr Woods?” She didn’t wait for a response, apparently having drawn her own conclusion. “Don’t worry, he’s going to get all the help he needs. We need to take him now but if you want to see him visiting hours are Wednesdays from 2pm to 4pm. However, we do asked that you not visit him for the first two weeks of his treatment, in order to not disturb the necessary adjustment period.”

The discussion continued, but faded out of your hearing as Emily started to move away, the breast in-front of you starting to bounce against your held form, rubbing you up and down as you fought to regain your bearings. The blonde was half-way across the lobby before you managed to call out. “Wait! There’s been a mistake! I’m not supposed to go to the wa-mph!” You were cut off as the hand against your back pushed harder, your mouth suddenly too full to function.

Above you, Emily cooed gently, fingers stroking your back in an attempt to impart comfort. “Shh… I know you’re confused right now, but you don’t have to worry okay. I’ve got all of your paperwork on my phone already. Mr Hunter Woods, age 21. High priority. Committed for treatment of long-term MDPD.” She smiled sadly, hating to see little guys like you in such distress due to conditions beyond your control. “We’re going to do all that we can to help, no matter how long it takes. Our ward has a great success rate in helping tinies like you find their true calling, no matter what it may be.”

You wanted to tell her that your ‘true calling’ was being a man, but your mouth remained full as she continued on, oblivious to your discomfort. “Some tinies remain in our care for years, but if you work hard I’m sure you can be out in a few short months.” Your blood ran cold at the idea of being confined to some institution for months, especially if that was the best case scenario. You had no idea what to expect, but you struggled and squirmed to make your displeasure known, only to be pressed yet harder into the yielding flesh before you as Emily cooed above. “Save your strength little guy. You should get some rest for now. The doctors will explain once we get to the ward.”

The sound of a car-door opening preceded a moment of vertigo as Emily dropped into the passenger seat and closed the door behind her. For a moment all you could hear was the steady beat of the blonde’s heart before the click of another door and a soft whump as Talia climbed in to the driver’s side. The car’s ignition roared to life and mild vibrations began to run through you as the vehicle pulled out into traffic and quickly carried you away from any hope of salvation. Beside you, the brunette spared a brief glance and smile for the little guy pressed against her partner’s chest before focusing back on the road. “It so sad that so many tinies loose their way like this. His friends really seemed to care for him too.” She sighed, but smiled a moment later as her fingers tapped at the wheel. “Still, it feels really good to be part of the solution you know?”

Emily smiled and laughed, finally releasing some of the pressure on you and allowing you to take deep breaths of air. “I know. I know. I hate that they have to deal with stuff like this, but it’s great that Dr Miller’s treatments have been so successful.” Cradling you in her palm, she reached down with her free hand to peel off her left flat and run a finger along the insole within, her smile soft as she did so. “I’m hoping that Dr Miller is going to approve Sammy for release soon. We’ve been working so hard these last few months and I just know we’ve made some real breakthroughs.” With a happy sound she slipped the shoe back on and gave it a few good stomps for emphasis.

Talia nodded knowingly. “Yeah. It’s taken him longer than some, but I think we’ve finally gotten there.” She shot another smile at her friend. “Thanks in no small part to you of course.” Emily blushed but nodded appreciatively as the brunette continued. “I’m also hoping that they’ll give Ben a clean bill of health soon as well.” Keeping both hands on the wheel, the prodigious girl twisted slightly in her seat, her mammoth rear shifting from side-to-side as it started to chew up the back of her pants. “I’ll be sad to see him go since we’ve been together for over a year now, but I just want what’s best for him, you know. And I’m sure all of the other girls who’ve cared for him would agree.” She laughed lightly, eyes flicking to you briefly as they pulled up to a red light. “I guess that means both of us may be available for a new charge in the near-future. Maybe even little Hunter here.”

Listening in, you had no idea what the two nurses were talking about, but suspected it was nothing good, especially as both women favoured you with inviting smiles. “Excuse me.” You nearly sighed in relief as your words didn’t prompt Emily to crush you to her chest once more. “Please tell me what you are talking about. Who is Dr Miller? What charges? Who are Sammy and Ben?” You had a million other questions as well but you felt those would do for now. You didn’t like the sound of any of this and just wished desperately that you could go back and undo your challenge to Rachel.

Giggling slightly, Emily unexpectedly lowered you away from her chest and instead placed you on the seat between her legs, the shelf of her breasts blocking your view of her face. Talia’s voice filtered down from above as the car rumbled back into motion. “You’ll have to wait for your evaluation. But we’ll happily show you the ropes after that.” You wanted to ask what an evaluation was, but were cut off as the car suddenly turned sharply and came to a stop once more. “We’re here.” This time it was the brunette who scooped you up, and you found yourself once more pressed into the inviting warmth of a woman’s chest as the two climbed out of the car and headed inside.

You heard the faint whir of automatic doors and the sound of a cherry greeting from a woman you couldn’t see, your vision dominated by Talia’s chest. It was Emily who responded. “Hey Grace. We brought the new guy, Hunter. Say hello little guy.” You were allowed to breath as your handler pulled you away from her chest enough to let you see the bespectacled brunette sitting behind what appeared to be a small reception desk, her smile kind and wave friendly as she met your gaze. “Welcome little guy. I’m so glad to have you here.” You couldn’t see all of her from her seated position, but from what you could see she was as curvy and beautiful as her colleagues.

No longer knowing what to even say you just waved back but remained quiet as you were carried past the reception, thinking perhaps it might be better to just wait and talk to this Dr Miller, hoping that they at least would be more reasonable. Such thoughts, however, were stricken from your mind as Emily and Talia stepped into the next room and your jaw dropped at the sight that awaited you.

More than a dozen beautiful women occupied the expansive space. All looking to be in their 20s, and with a wide range of ethnicities, yet all matching in regard to their massive curves and universally beautiful complexions. On one side of the room several donned the same purple scrubs as Emily and Talia and either sat at a table playing cards or milled around a coffee machine, seemingly waiting for something. On the other side a smaller group were engaging in what appeared to be a full-powered workout. A freckled redhead, fiery hair flowing out behind her, was running full-tilt on a treadmill, her beautiful form clad only in a tan thong and bra that appeared several sizes too small, while her feet lacked shoes, covered only in what appeared to be tan socks of some kind. Nearby, two other nurses, one who appeared of Southeast Asian descent, and the other Middle Eastern seemed to be cooling down after their own intense workouts, their bodies slick with sweat as they shared a tan washcloth that already looked to be filled to bursting to wipe away the excess perspiration.

Mesmerised, and more than a little aroused, you were momentarily too caught up in day dreams to realise the truth. It was only when a younger nurse whose look you could best describe as ‘perky goth’ missed her mark during an enthusiastic one-woman game of handball against the nearest wall that you realised the cruel reality. Off-balance, the raven-haired girl’s foot slammed down on the tan ball she had been using to play, a squeak of surprise emitting from her throat followed by an earnest “Sorry!” and the look of someone who had just accidentally kicked a puppy. A tan object addressed as a living thing. Something you recognised all too well. Realising exactly what kind of fate awaited you here, you began to struggle desperately, pushing at the fingers that surrounded you as you tried to pull free. Caught off guard, Talia grip loosened slightly as she looked down at you in concern.

But do you manage to escape, or do you remain at the mercy of the oblivious nurses?
1153211221111.title: On the Road to Purgatory

choices: Give you to Emily or Talia (or both), to replace their graduating tinies.
Give you to Allira, who is enthusiastic to finally get a tiny. [Reserved]
Give you to one of the ward’s other nurses (*Writer’s Choice*).
11532112211113.content:
[This chapter was written in collaboration with kla]

Though her grip had slackened for a moment, Talia recovered quickly, bringing you back to her chest as she tried to comfort you. “Hunter, what’s wrong? Calm down please. You’re safe here.” You didn’t listen, just kept pulling until an arm slipped free and you entertained a small hope of freedom. Then Emily stepped in to help her friend, a shadow flashing over your vision the only warning you got before the two chests collided, pressing together and trapping you between the firm masses, only your head sticking out to stare up in defiance. With your chest squished and mangled you were unable to scream out in protest as the two nurses cooed above you, gazes kind but determined.

Drawn by the commotion, several of the waiting nurses started to approach, their eyes trained solely on your tiny form betwixt their colleague’s assets with beneficent smiles driving icy daggers of fear into your heart. An ochre-skinned girl of unclear ethnicity seemed particularly enthusiastic, almost knocking over her chair in her hurry to come and help. Her hair was dyed a deep crimson-hue and secured in a long ponytail that bobbed along behind her as she jogged. A small stampede of other nurses followed in her wake, their collective assets jiggling all over the place as they moved, which you now realised promised nothing but torment for your time in this facility.

Much to your relief, short-lived though it may be, the stampede of incoming nurses was stopped in its tracks as a throat was cleared loudly, all of them turning to look as a shorter woman with a stern expression and piercing blue eyes stared at them all from a doorway at the far end of the room. She was older than the nurses and notably less endowed, a few grey hairs beginning to show among short blonde locks. From the clipboard she held and the white coat she was wearing, you suspected she was a doctor and held onto some small hope that she might yet save you.

As the woman strode slowly across the room Emily and Talia finally separated, leaving you exposed and gasping for air as you hung limply from Talia’s grasp. Looking you up and down with an apathetic gaze, the doctor made a tutting noise and glanced down at her clipboard. “Hunter Woods. Admitted due to a severe case of Minus Dissociative Personality Disorder causing both multiple personalities and several incidents of acute memory loss, as well as an apparent inability to determine on a day-to-day basis whether you want to be used as an object or seen as a man.” You tried to protest, but she cut you off. “It also says here that you’ve begun to hallucinate and create imagined conspiracies aimed against yourself.” She turned the clipboard so you could see it and pointed to a scrawl near the bottom. “Fortunately young man, we have your signature to give you all the help you need.”

The ochre-skinned girl smiled at you sadly as your condition was set out, inching slightly closer as she did so. Up close, you realised that this girl was younger than your current holders, likely in her late teens or very early twenties and that despite an obviously high level of tone she sported a set of curves that put even Quinn to shame, her breasts seemingly defying gravity as they stretched the too thin fabric of her top. “You poor thing. Don’t worry though, because the nurses here are the best and we’re going to look after you little guy.” She smiled so wide you thought it might have hurt. “I’m just getting started here myself but I’ll do everything I can to help you get better.”

Clearing her throat again, the doctor sent a small glare at the crimson-haired girl before addressing you once more. “As I was saying. I am Doctor Miller, and I am in charge of all of our patients here, including you. The nurse who interrupted me…” The younger girl blushed and smiled sheepishly. “…is Allira, our newest nurse in training. You two are both newbies of a sort.”

“Please, you don’t understand.” You tried to argue. Tried to make them see sense. “I’m not supposed to be here. Those documents are fake. I just want to go home.” Unfortunately, Miller just smiled a flat, unreadable smile, her eyes betraying no emotion. “We want you to be able to go home as well Mr Woods, but it just won’t be safe for you until you are cured. Why, one day you may be perfectly content as some nice girl’s new bra, then the next you may wake up suddenly convinced that everything you previously knew to be true is wrong. Just think of how traumatic that might be for the both of you.” She shook her head. “No, you need to get better young man.”

Everywhere you looked you could see nurses nodding along in agreement, each and every one of them looking at you sympathetically, like you were truly some broken thing in need of help. You realised with rising dread that Miller had them all totally under her thumb, and that anything you might say would just be argued away in the face of her experience and those ‘signed’ documents. You wondered if even she knew the truth, or if the doctor was just another person deceived by Rachel, convinced of the righteousness of her own purpose regardless of mounting evidence.

While you contemplated your fate, Miller held out her hand expectantly towards Talia, who handed you over without protest. The rougher surface of the older woman’s palm shocked you out of your thoughts, and you looked up only to see the blonde paying you no attention as she turned and walked back the way she had come, navigating a short hallway before stepping into a small office. You briefly contemplated another escape attempt, now that you only had one opponent to worry about, but no sooner had the heavy door slid to then the doctor simply dropped you onto her desk.

Striking the surface with a painful thump, you felt your legs squish beneath your weight, and turned to glare up at the careless woman. Your anger faltered in the face of fear though as Miller’s apathetic smile turned sadistic and she chuckled slowly. “Don’t bother trying to scream pest. This room is sound-proofed. Those stupid nurses won’t be able to hear you now.” Fear gave way to anger once more as you shouted out. “You knew!” But the cruel woman just responded by prodding you with a finger and knocking you onto your back, pressing down on your chest and keeping you pinned with utter ease. “Of course I did. Did you think I’d be blind to what goes on in my own facility?”

She sneered as she continued to look down at you like she was inspecting a bug. “You need to accept that you’ve lost. I don’t know what you did to piss off Rachel, but that was perhaps the last mistake you will ever make. You belong to me now. You leave when I say so. If I say so. As I say so.” Another dark chuckle rose from her throat. “And don’t expect those foolish girls to help you. We pick them very carefully to ensure ongoing compliance. They’re all compassionate souls to be sure, but they are also the kind of people who defer to authority, and their opinion of your kind tends more towards how one might treat a child or a pet. Fitting, given that you are certainly not a man.”

Though your blood boiled, you tried to maintain a modicum of calm as you spoke. “You. Can’t. Keep me here. My family will come looking for me. My friends know where I am. They’ll find out what you’re doing here.” If you really thought about it there was no way this situation could last. No matter what lies Rachel had told your roommates, those same excuses wouldn’t fly with your family.

Miller just smirked at your words, her tone mocking as she spoke. “Really now. We’ve done it so many times before, what makes you think that you will be special. If your family won’t believe the first lie then we’ll just tell them another. After all, in the eyes of the law, you signed up for this.” With the hand not holding you down she flicked through a couple of files on her desk. “You’ve met Emily and Talia. I wonder, did Talia introduce you to her thong, or did Emily let you meet her insole? Did you perhaps feel a sense of kinship with them?” Her smirk only grew as she watched your face twitch in recognition and she found the files she was looking for, laying them out beside you.

“Samuel Reynolds. Arrogant enough to think that he could tutor real humans, like some kind of equal. Isabella lured him in with a fake job offer and then we put him in his place.” Blue eyes shifted to the second file. “Ben Smith. Somehow managed to trick some foolish girl into agreeing to marry him. Yakima, I think her name was.” She shook her head, nostrils flaring in outrage. “Ridiculous. Fortunately for everyone involved, Rachel managed to scoop him up before they could go through with the nuptials.” The doctor looked back to you, sneering in disgust. “They were defiant like you at first. So were their so-called families, but they came around in time. And now after years of being traded between the nurses, the two of them are almost ready for release.” Miller chuckled, though there was no true mirth in her expression. “Of course, not as men. No, they’ve been cured of that arrogant delusion. The two of them will make fine additions to someone’s wardrobe.”

You continued to glare at the doctor, though inside you were gradually losing hope. “I will get out of he-.” A finger flicked you in the face, snapping your head back and stunning you temporarily. “No. You won’t.” Her voice was cold now, and would brook no further disagreement. “Here, my word is law, and it is I who will decide on your primary caregiver. Maybe I’ll give you to Emily to replace Sam, or to Talia to replace Ben. Or perhaps you would prefer young Allira. You’d be her first charge so I’m sure she would take extra special care of you. Of course, you’d still be seeing the others as well.”

You knew you had no choice in the matter, just glaring balefully until Dr Miller decided to…

11532112212.content:
As you flew from Morgan’s grip time seemed to slow for you. You looked around the bus to see all the women who had been staring at you excitedly when they heard about your usage license begin to shift in their seats in anticipation now that they saw you were separated from your roommates. You saw Morgan’s panicked face as she realised she had lost her grip of you, but didn’t see exactly where in the air you were, or where you were flying towards.
Speaking of which, you turned around to see your destination. You could see the eyes of the bus driver in the rear view mirror tracking your movement, she looked ecstatic that her plan had worked as you were now sailing through the air in a perfect arc towards her. You saw a few of the women in between Morgan and the front of the bus reach up to try to catch you, and a few of them come close, their fingers brushing against you. You yelped every time one of their hands swept past you, but your fear of them seemed misplaced, because the real danger was where you were about to land. The bus driver eagerly watched you arc through the air, sailing over her head and landing with a barely audible splat at her feet, just in front of the pedals her feet were currently resting on. As you took a second to get your bearings you managed to take in the appearance of your new tormentor.
Even from your perspective on the floor you could see she was heavyset, she seemed to be incredibly pear shaped, you could see the sides of her ass peeking out over the sides of her chair, as well as her pudgy stomach hanging over her belt slightly. Her face showed some signs of age, you’d guess she was around 45 or so, and her brown, slightly greying hair was cut short and pulled back in a bun. You managed to catch a glimpse of her name tag, which told you her name was Janice, before your sight of her was blocked by the sole of her shoe. The shoe stomped down on you and she twisted her heel on top of you, grinding you into the treads of her shoes. You silently screamed, your head too mangled for you to actually be able to make any noice, as this cruel woman ground you into the sole of her shoe like a used cigarette. Once she was sure you were stuck in the treads of her shoe she lifted her foot, carrying you with it back onto the break pedal, resting it there while she turned to your roommates as the bus doors swung open.
“Alright girls, this is your stop. I’ve got a schedule to keep so if you could be quick,” Janice spoke with an impatience that could probably be interpreted as her simply being frustrated with her job, but you knew she wanted your roommates off the bus before they discovered your location.
“Hold on a minute, I just dropped our tiny guy we had with us, give us a minute to find him please!” You heard the panicked voice of Morgan pleading with Janice. “We can’t just leave him on the bus.”
“Sorry girls but I’m already late as it is. Tell you girls what, I’ll give you a minute or two but after that I really need you guys off here. My boss has been giving me grief about running late all the time, you understand don’t you?” Janice would normally have just driven on if a passenger was refusing to get off the bus, but she really didn’t want the three girls on any longer than they had to be, otherwise they could possibly discover you.

With that time limit in place, the girls hurried in trying to locate you. Morgan knew you had been thrown forward, she just wasn’t sure exactly where you went. Quinn had saw a few of the women further down reaching up for you, but wasn’t exactly sure if one of them had caught you or not. With those two facts in mind, your roommates began to search for you. Morgan went down to the front of the bus to look for you there, Quinn began interrogating the girls who she saw reaching for you, and Avery began looking on the floor and under the seats for you.
Seeing the girls so organised and efficiently searching for you worried Janice, she expected them to panic and not manage to search the whole are you could have been in. Her nerves caused her to absentmindedly grind her heels into the floor, further compacting you between the grooves of her shoes. She silently prayed that they would run out of time before they started to suspect her. Do they discover you?

1) Yes, and they manage to convince Janice to give you up.
2) Yes, but you are either too crushed into the grooves of her shoe for them to recover you, or Janice uses your usage license as defence to keep you.
3) No, and they have to leave the bus and go to the C.T.C building without you, potentially making removing the license much more difficult.
11532112212.title: Thrown Under the Bus Driver

choices: Meeting with Isabella
Isabella was expecting you
No sign of Isabella
115321122121.content:
For the next two minutes you suffered through being ground further into the treads of the bus driver’s shoes, as she tried to better conceal you from your roommate’s frantic searching which was getting closer and closer to your hiding place under her foot. You silently cried out to them, but your mangled body could make no sounds.
Quinn was the first to finish her job of finding out if any of the girls had managed to catch you. Her deadpan face and annoyed scowls were enough to intimidate most of the women into telling the truth and she determined that none of them had caught you, moving on to help Avery look for you on the floor after that.
Their search also proved fruitless, and after two minutes they both looked to Morgan, who had been searching the front of the bus for you and only had the area around the driver left to check.

Janice had been eying the clock like a hawk, praying for time to move faster. She had began to panic as she saw Morgan get closer to her, but a smile crept up from the corners of her mouth as she saw the clock tick over once again, time was up. She quickly hid her grin, before turning to Morgan with a look of faux concern.
“Sorry girls, times up. Sorry but I’ve got a schedule to keep,” she was straining to keep her grin from reemerging, but must have done a bad job at it because Morgan looked at her with confusion.
“Why are you in such a rush to have us off this bus? Most drivers would have just shrugged and drove on with us still on board, are you hiding something?” Hearing Morgan say this, Quinn and Avery approached.

“N-no, why? How could I have him?” Janice was not a good lier under pressure, and the tone of her voice was starting to give her away.
“Because you wanted him to fly out of Morgan’s hand. Why else would you have hit the breaks?” Quinn’s flat tone of voice did not match the brimming anger in her eyes, she realised now what was going on. “Just hand him over and we won’t have to report you.”
Janice opened her mouth to respond, but thought better of it, she was already on thin ice with her supervisor and didn’t need any more trouble. She lifted her foot up and began prying you loose with her fingernail. There was a brief moment that you feared she wouldn’t actually be able to get you out, but that fear was placated as you felt your body slip out from between the tight treads.
Your body slipped out as a long, thin piece of string, having been tightly compacted into a single tread of her shoe. One of your eyes was still visible so you could look up at your would be kidnapper. Her face had an expression similar to a child who got caught shoplifting, as she glumly handed your stringy form over to Quinn, who wordlessly grabbed you from the bus driver with a cold glare.
Your three giantess friends exited the bus without another word, and it pulled away, leaving you all to look up at the C.T.C office building. As you were now in the shadow of the building, knowing that the woman who had caused you so much hardship was inside and that you would have to see her soon, you shuddered.
Quinn, feeling your shivering body vibrate against her hand, looked down at you reassuringly before looking up at the building again and walking towards it, determined to help you out of this situation.

Your anxiety shot through the roof as Quinn walked through the double doors into the stuffy reception hall of the C.T.C office building. There was a long line to talk to the single, very bored looking receptionist. Quinn let out a heavy sigh and joined the back of the line while you saw Morgan and Avery sit down in the seating area, looking bored already. A few moments after joining the line your body popped back into shape, allowing you to look around.
As you looked at the other people standing in the line you noticed a similar trend between all of them. All of them either had tiny men with them or had some kind of tan clothing on display. You started considering your own situation and wondered how many of the men here had been assigned usage licenses against their will. Even further how many had their licenses assigned by the very woman you were trying to speak to, Isabella.
Baker’s Law, in your opinion, had done more harm than good. The woman who managed to push it through seemed to have noble intentions, but the law she helped create may very well have ruined your life, and possibly the lives of many of the other guys in this room.
Deep in thought you strangely seemed to blame Amy Baker more than Isabella herself, which you realised was stupid and shook yourself out of it. Looking back around the room you saw that the line had moved up a lot while you were thinking and you and Quinn were almost at the front. Realising this, you began to panic slightly, the thought of seeing Isabella again making you incredibly anxious.
Seeing your distress, Quinn looked down at you.
“Listen Hunter, I know you’re worried about this, but you need to get your head in the game here. We’ll be here to back you up but in the end it’s you that’s in this situation so you are going to have to put in the work to get out of it,” Quinn’s small speech knocked you out of your doom and gloom attitude.
“Yeah you’re right Quinn, thanks.”

You were forced to become very well acquainted with the taste of the recess between Quinn’s big and second toe, and it seemed like a taste you would never truly get used to. The smell was another thing that continually bothered you, as it lingered even when Quinn wasn’t wearing you, and made it difficult to sleep at night.

As the days wore on, Quinn’s constant pounding under her foot was starting to make your body conform to the contours of her foot, just like the part of the flip flop you had replaced. Unlike the part you had replaced however, you didn’t have the luxury of breaking.

*****

On your fourth day of being worn by Quinn, Isabella arrived for her inspection.

Your roommates had been relaxing in the living room, you couldn’t see any of the other girls because Quinn had her foot propped up on the coffee table, so you could only see her. You saw her glance at you occasionally with a slightly guilty look on her face, but otherwise she was engrossed in something on her phone. You could hear Morgan and Avery chatting as Quinn’s toes idly squeezed and toyed with your tongue and face.

The quiet atmosphere was broken by a knock at the door. Quinn made no move to go answer it, but you heard one of the twins footsteps as they went to answer it.

A few moments later you heard the clack of heels on the wooden floor of the hallway. Quinn looked up at the new arrival and you could tell it was Isabella based of the scowl that crossed Quinn’s face the instant she saw her.

“Morning everyone!” You heard Isabella say pleasantly to everyone. Quinn rolled her eyes at the cruel woman trying to act nice. Isabella continued. “So, I’ll just get down to business and then I can be out of your hair, have you all settled on a place for Hunter? Or do I have to take him with me?”

Quinn wordlessly kicked your flipflop off of her foot and onto the coffee table. You looked up towards Isabella as she leaned over to pick the flip flop up to inspect it. Her nose crinkled slightly at the strong smell coming off of them, and she looked confused briefly, before her eyes widened and she began to grin as she spotted your eyes looking up at her.

“Well, this use was... unexpected,” she looked like she was struggling to contain her laughter and stay professional. “But it certainly fits well with the guidelines Hunter and I straightened out when he applied for the license. Thank you all for finally seeing sense and giving little Hunter exactly what he deserved.”

You heard Quinn and Morgan grumble something inaudibly and you imagined Avery would be nodding in agreement.
Turning her head back you you, Isabella smiled warmly, although you could see the malice in her eyes.
“Got some good news for you as well Hunter! I put your reasoning for your application on record, as well as some of your caregivers misgivings about your intentions. I also added the transcript of our little group chat the other day on record, highlighting both mine and Avery’s statements about your desire to be used, so it’s all extra evidence in our favour. So now your license is all the more protected against removal, isn’t that great!”

You were crestfallen, but couldn’t do anything to vocalise it. Isabella had used your visit to her office to build her case! She seemed to be trying to discredit Quinn and Morgan, so they’d be less able to argue on your behalf! If she wasn’t actively trying to ensure that you would spend the rest of your life as an object, you would have to admire her intelligence.

As she smiled and set you gently back on the table, you looked to Quinn and Morgan, both distraught over the news Isabella had just delivered.
Satisfied that she had ruined everyone’s morning, Isabella smiled and said goodbye before leaving.

Everyone simply sat in silence for a few moments, before looking to you apologetically. All except Avery, who looked at you with happiness at seeing your rights protected.

*****

Back to the present, you were currently laying on the floor of the living room, next to the couch, your partner flip flop laying next to you. Quinn had taken just you off after finally giving in to Avery’s constant pestering that she wanted to paint her roommates toenails because she was bored, having already painted her own.

“Ugh, fine, if it’ll stop you badgering me about it,” Quinn groaned, not taking her eyes away from her phone. Quinn and Morgan had been trying to find a way to counter Isabella’s efforts, despite that disastrous visit from her three weeks ago. She had simply kicked you off without even looking at you. You had noticed her treatment of you was becoming much more distant and callous, but you figured it was from guilt at having to wear you as long, as well as becoming increasingly distracted by the efforts to free you.

“Yay! Oh you won’t regret this Quinn, I’ll have your toes looking fantabulous in no time! I think I’ll paint them an uber pretty pink to match your favourite flip flops,” Avery had seemingly completely forgotten you existed, since she hadn’t acknowledged you in almost a week. You could only look up to the pink haired giantess as she excitedly rushed over to the coffee table and sat down, grabbing one of Quinn’s feet and beginning to concentrate on painting her nails, cutely sticking her tongue out in concentration while she did it.

“Does it have to be pink though, I’d prefer black,” Quinn complained, but made no move to stop Avery, her apathetic nature showing itself.

“Quinn, you should know by now that I don’t do dark colours,” Avery giggled, and simply trailed off into an unending stream of chatter about how pretty Quinn’s feet would look by the time she was finished with them, among other topics.

You zoned out of the conversation, simply taking the rare chance to look around a room without your view being obstructed by Quinn’s pounding toes.

After around ten minutes, Quinn huffed in annoyance.
“Again! Really! My new flip flops got delayed again!” Quinn fumed. Her anger stemmed more from frustration of the shipping company than concern for you, you had momentarily slipped her mind while Avery was painting her toenails.

“Wait, why do you need new flip flops when you’ve got a set of perfectly good ones...” Avery trailed off as her eyes drifted to you. “Oh yeah, Hunter, duh! Hey cutie, how you doing down there? Ready to be my thong yet?”

Avery’s unending positivity was a novelty that had worn off entirely over your month long stint as Quinn’s footwear, so you could only roll your eyes in annoyance.

“No Avery. Hunter signed up to be my flip flop and I still need him since my damn delivery has been delayed again,” Quinn caught herself as she suddenly sounded incredibly selfish in regards to wearing you. Blushing, she simply went quiet.

Avery finished up on Quinn’s toenails, before your ridiculously curvy roommate turned owner slid her foot back into her flip flops and walked up to her room.
Sitting on the edge of her bed, she looked down at you with a pitying expression on her face.
“Sorry about that earlier, Hunter. I was frustrated about my order getting delayed again, along with this whole legal battle we’ve got going with that evil notary,” Quinn sighed. “Looks like I’ll need to use you for another while though, since my replacement flip flops keep getting delayed and it doesn’t look like we’ll be getting rid of your license for a while either. To be in with the best chance, we need to try and find proof that Isabella forged your signature, because she’s got us cornered otherwise. Anyway, I’ve got work in the morning, so good night.”

Quinn got ready for bed and you were soon left in darkness as she switched the lights off.
Left to your thoughts you could only fear how casual everyone was becoming with you in this form. If you weren’t freed soon you feared that the way your roommates treated you could irreversibly changed, you wanted them to view you as an equal, not the footwear of one of their real roommates.
In the end you couldn’t do anything to change it, you would just have to hope that Quinn and Morgan would come through for you.

1) Quinn is approached by a member of the public who witnessed your confrontation with Rachel and Isabella at the beach, wondering if you were ok since they hadn’t seen you working as a lifeguard since then. Possibly a lead to freeing you?
2) After three months, Quinn’s flip flops arrive. What happens to you?
3) You are stolen while Quinn is saving someone at Sanderson Beach and isn’t wearing you.
